Company  : AHI agilon health, inc. Location  : Remote - USA Job Title  : Sr. Data Analyst Job Description  : As a Senior Data Analyst in a cross-functional team, you'll provide support to the organization in various aspects related to data, analytics, and operations. You'll not only gather data, validate data acquisition methods, reformat data but also ensure appropriate data types, trimming, cleaning, scrubbing, and conforming data in preparation for analysis and reporting. How You'll Contribute Apply data quality management principles in multi-functional settings specifically across the administrative and financial information supply chain as well as clinical progression of care. Interact with various business data owners, data production system staff, data analysts, and decision makers to develop and implement proactive data quality monitoring procedures and practices Resolve data quality incidents reported to Data Quality & Governance (DQG) from data users across the enterprise Aggregates data and aid in data cleaning and management. Uses data quality tools to proactively identify data integrity issues. Collaborate with team members to innovate and provide guidance for DQG in documentation and support including advocating for excellence in quality and customer service, increased automation and efficiency, and proactive business process improvements. Performs data and process validations for recurring and ad hoc data loads and analytics for internal and external customers. Conducts analyses of large data sets and produces reports utilizing tools such as SQL, R, and the Microsoft Suite for use in team meetings, presentations, and customer deliverables. Develop tools, metrics, reports, and analyses to drive key business decisions. Design and create dashboards in Tableau or similar software Consult with all impacted users to understand priorities and identify current operating procedures and clarify program objectives Communicate with users to accurately gather information to develop accurate and testable requirements for in-house applications and/or accurate reports and analysis. Contribute to the test planning and execution of new and existing software applications and/or dashboards. Peer reviews code and reports developed by other analysts and developers. Documents entire analysis process, including business problem, data sources, methods and tools utilized to complete projects/tasks Assists internal and external users in resolving operational issues. Provides insight and feedback for new technology and upcoming industry standards. What You'll Bring 2+ years’ experience in one or more of the following: Health Care Finance, Health Care Compliance and/or General Health Plan Operations, Health Care Analytics/Reporting, Programming Experience in transforming, cleaning, and manipulating raw data. Experience in a Healthcare / Government Programs fields is strongly preferred. Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. Ability to read, analyze and interpret technical procedures and deal with several abstract and concrete variables. Ability to translate business needs into technical requirements Working knowledge with data visualization tools such as Tableau, PowerBI, Sigma Computing Experience in data base design and programming concepts, including relational databases (PostgreSQL, MySQL, MS SQL Server, Oracle). Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Business Administration or closely related field; or related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.

job_title: Senior Data Scientist, Slack Connect - Slack
job_Description: To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts. Job Category Products and Technology Job Details We are hiring an experienced data scientist for our Slack Connect product area. This cross-functional team focuses on building features to connect users and teams across organizations to enable productive and proficient cross-company collaboration. Slack Connect has been a huge success since its initial launch! A full stack Data Scientist is welcome to join this fast growing team to contribute to the dream of enabling our customers to collaborate efficiently and safely across organizations in a friction free way. In this role, you will seek to understand how Slack Connect features are being adopted and how they are shifting the nature of collaboration within Slack. You will help to establish the foundational analytics infrastructure for Slack Connect. You will be a strong partner to PMs, Researchers, and Engineers as you work collectively to refine Slack’s strategy in this strategic area. You will also inform and influence decisions using data and research by crafting our findings into narratives and partnering with key decision makers within and across product pillars. You will have a unique opportunity to partner with world class researchers with varying backgrounds, including user researchers, market researchers, and survey scientists to uncover user experience gaps and opportunities. Slack has a positive, diverse, and supportive culture—we look for people who are curious, inventive, and work to be a little better every single day. In our work together we aim to be smart, humble, hardworking and, above all, collaborative. If this sounds like a good fit for you, why not say hello? What you will be doing Apply various data science methods to understand the most meaningful aspects of our product, users, and business Evangelize evidence-based decision making by partnering with key decision makers and driving general accessibility of data and insights Partner with data engineering org to design and build slack connect data and metrics structure Organize disparate facts and findings into narratives that inform product strategy Define and drive alignment around success metrics for slack connect and provide data informed target setting What you should have 3+ years of professional industry Data Science or Analytics experience, ideally within a consumer facing technology industry An advanced degree (MS, PhD) in a quantitative field (e.g. Computer Science, Economics, Physics) a plus A proven record of using data to drive product teams to release new features and achieve ambitious goals Expertise in at least one programming language for data analysis (e.g. Python, R) Expertise in designing and deep-diving experiments to guide product launch decisions Experience using statistical and machine learning methods to build descriptive and predictive models Experience working with data technologies that allow effective storage and analysis of large amounts of data (e.g. Spark, Presto, Hive, Hadoop, etc) Experience in building advanced data pipelines and designing data scheme and table infrastructure Strong written and verbal communication skills Experience working in fast changing tech development environment Experience collaborating with and influencing cross functional partners For Colorado-based roles: Minimum annual salary of $121,800. You may also be entitled to receive bonus, restricted stock units, and benefits. More details about our company benefits can be found at the following link:  https://www.getsalesforcebenefits.com/ Accommodations If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form . We are looking to hire a  Product Manager - Data Science & Analytics  to establish and drive a data-led vision and roadmap to transform our products and ultimately our industry. This role will give you the opportunity to collaborate with colleagues throughout Fourth, as well as customers, partners, end-users, and the industry at large. And you’ll be supported at every step by peers and leaders who are invested in your success.   What You'll Be Doing. . . Establish yourself as the expert on our capabilities and the market, both internally and externally Define and execute the product strategy and roadmap, working closely with colleagues in Product, Engineering, User Experience, and Data Science Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand their questions and challenges in order to expand our usage of data throughout our product portfolio Build excitement internally through demos, training sessions and any other avenue you can dream up Develop and deliver go-to-market launch plans, and write business cases for new investments Provide guidance to the Data Science team by providing product requirements, as well as clarifying customer goals and business priorities to ensure they focus on our highest impact projects Coordinate with other Product teams to ensure smooth integration and launch of new capabilities Partner with Marketing to drive customer and industry awareness of the cool things you’re building Work with internal stakeholders and third parties to assess and establish fruitful partnerships Perform product demos to prospects, customers and partners  What You Need to Have. . . An understanding of Data Science, paired with hands-on analytical skills Experience as a Product Manager for a SaaS company, preferably in a Data or Analytics role Excitement to apply cutting-edge machine learning and data science technologies to transform how restaurants, hotels, and stores run their businesses. The ability to explain highly technical concepts to a non-technical audience and a comfort acting as “the bridge” between highly technical and highly business-oriented teams A love of complex, interconnected systems and the data they generate A natural inclination toward collaboration, transparency and respect Comfortable working in an Agile delivery environment, as a part of a globally distributed team Our Story In July 2019 Fourth joined forces with HotSchedules to become the global leader in end-to-end restaurant and hospitality management technology solutions. Together, the merged company now represents the world’s largest and only provider of end-to-end restaurant and hospitality management solutions for customers across the globe and of all sizes—from a single location or franchisee restaurant to a global restaurant or hotel chain. The combined company’s complete software-as-service (SaaS) solution suite including: scheduling, time & attendance, applicant tracking, training, inventory management / procurement, HR / benefits and payroll services now serves customers in 120,000 locations worldwide and is supported by a dedicated, unified team across offices in the US, UK, Bulgaria, China, Australia and UAE. Fourth is an Equal Opportunity Employer All qualified applicants will receive consideration without discrimination because of sex, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, race, color, age, national origin, military status, religion, or disability or any other legally protected status.

Location:  Pasadena, CA HQ or   Remote within USA  The Role  Our fast-growing AI and Solutions teams are looking for a highly-motivated Applied Data Scientist to create compelling AI use-cases and solutions using Virtualitics platforms. You will be responsible for developing and enabling pre-sales demo's, data stories, and executing POC and prototypes of AI solutions. You will not only be helping sell our groundbreaking technology, but be a part of building a truly great company and culture.  Responsibilities  Applying recent and emerging trends in data science and AI in a diverse set of verticals (healthcare, biotech, energy, transportation, financial services, etc.). Work with the rest of the Solutions team and AI team to scope and build out amazing solutions concepts with VIP and Virtualitics Predict! Meet and pitch to executives and domain experts regularly. Collaborate with product teams to design and conceptualize new capabilities  Qualifications  Degree in Computer Science/EE/Applied Math/Statistics or related 2-3 years of experience in Python data science stack: numpy, pandas, scikit-learn, tensorflow/pytorch, pyspark, dask, matplotlib, seaborn, bokeh, etc. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Comfortable with public speaking and presenting to executives. Patience and excitement to work with customers through proof-of-concepts. Experience with SQL/NoSQL or other databases (elasticsearch, graph databases, etc.). Experience with Git (or an alternative version control tool). A strong sense of ownership and accountability; eagerness to learn skills as needed by business focus Major Pluses: Consulting experience  Compensation  We offer: Competitive base salary based on experience 100% employer paid health benefit premiums (medical, dental, vision) Unlimited Paid Time Off Paid Time Off for National Holidays Stock options at sign-on 401k plan Company equipment (Laptop computer, monitor, iPhone, etc.) Remote work from home  About Us  Virtualitics is an augmented analytics company that helps our clients expand access to complex data to make their work more visual, collaborative, and actionable. Our powerful suite of augmented analytical tools allows our clients to harness the power of artificial intelligence (AI) and multidimensional visualizations to elevate their unstructured data analysis in a no-code environment and communicate their findings in ways that are instantly understood across their entire organization. Our patented technology is based on over 11 years of research at the California Institute of Technology and NASA/JPL and supported by a talented team of data scientists, designers, and engineers with several hundred publications in the field of artificial intelligence and data visualization. We have office space in Pasadena, CA, but are also open to fully remote candidates. Virtualitics is committed to building a company where every individual can bring their full impact and reach their fullest potential. Our mission is to build a diverse and inclusive environment where talented people of all cultures, ages, perspectives, opinions, education, backgrounds, races, gender identity, religions, orientations, abilities, and beliefs can grow and thrive with Virtualitics.  Check us out at https://virtualitics.com/careers

Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that's improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There's no room for error. Join us and start doing  your life's best work.(sm) You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.  Primary Responsibilities: Generate analytics for existing value-based contracts to validate attribution, quality performance and financial reconciliations. Determine data visualization requirements, recommend appropriate tools and techniques, create, and maintain data visualization outputs. Report clinical, quality total cost savings initiatives benchmarks, trend analyses, and provider performance monthly to help achieve savings goals. Support routine and ad-hoc value-based contract financial and performance reporting. Report qualitative analysis on product performance of value-based risk model at both provider and payer level dimension reporting. Evaluates and communicates underlying cost drivers, root caused, and financial risk factors impacting shared savings Analyze data to understand source data availability and fit for purpose Maintain value-based reporting business glossary and/or master data to assist content owners and subject matter experts. Analysis, evaluation, report findings of quality improvement and cost reduction capabilities of any new providers or methodologies added to value-based program Works closely with development team to migrate value-based models into technical requirements. Manipulate and generate insights from large payer claims and clinical datasets. What are the reasons to consider working for UnitedHealth Group? Put it all together - competitive base pay, a full and comprehensive benefit program, performance rewards, and a management team who demonstrates their commitment to your success. Some of our offerings include: Paid Time Off which you start to accrue with your first pay period plus 8 Paid Holidays Medical Plan options along with participation in a Health Spending Account or a Health Saving account Dental, Vision, Life& AD&D Insurance along with Short-term disability and Long-Term Disability coverage 401(k) Savings Plan, Employee Stock Purchase Plan Education Reimbursement Employee Discounts Employee Assistance Program Employee Referral Bonus Program Voluntary Benefits (pet insurance, legal insurance, LTC Insurance, etc.) More information can be downloaded at: http://uhg.hr/uhgbenefits You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in. Required Qualifications: Bachelor degree in Healthcare, Finance, Business Analytics or related field 5+ years data analysis experience 3+ years Experience in value-based care and impact of VBC on healthcare spend, for both providers and payers using applicable financial risk and nominal standards 3+ years Working knowledge of analysis and reporting on Oncology evidence-based treatments pathways and national quality forum metrics 2+ years Strong data visualizations skills in tools such as Power BI/Tableau 2+ years Experience using data analysis tools such as SQL, Excel, Power Query or equivalent 3+ years Healthcare industry experience Preferred Qualifications: Excellent communication, time/project management, problem solving, organizational, and analytical skills required  To protect the health and safety of our workforce, patients, and communities we serve, UnitedHealth Group and its affiliate companies now require all employees to disclose COVID-19 vaccination status prior to beginning employment. Candidates must be able to perform all essential job functions with or without reasonable accommodation. Failure to meet the vaccination requirement may result in rescission of an employment offer or termination of employment.  Careers with Optum.  Here's the idea. We built an entire organization around one giant objective; make health care work better for everyone. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do  your life's best work.(sm) *All Telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, etc. In addition to your salary, UnitedHealth Group offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). No matter where or when you begin a career with UnitedHealth Group, you’ll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentives   Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.  UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Job Title: Sr. Data Scientist - Experimentation Role Overview: You will work in an exciting and dynamic area of experimentation and A/B testing that inspires continuous improvements to McAfee products and will have huge impact on millions of consumers' digital life and security . If you love diving into massive datasets but also want the opportunity to shape the vision and strategic role of Product Analytics then this may be the role for you. Working with members of Product, Marketing, Data Science and Engineering teams, you will determine and report on metrics, analyze customer behaviors/data, improve our products and content and build tools/service to improve Analytics productivity. You will report to the Director of Engineering and work out of one of our hub locations.  Company Overview McAfee is a leader in personal security for consumers. Focused on protecting people, not just devices, McAfee consumer solutions adapt to users’ needs in an always online world, empowering them to live securely through integrated, intuitive solutions that protects their families and communities with the right security at the right moment. About the role: You will analyze consumer behavior, product usage and marketing data to identify opportunities and create hypothesis for product improvements, consumer experience enhancements and business optimization. You will use statistical models to forecast, size and prioritize ideas for A/B testing. You will design and execute experiments to help us validate hypothesis and relationships in the data You will develop, deploy and own tools, best practice methodologies, processes and standards for A/B testing across the organization You will implement and analyze A/B or Multi-Variate Tests to help us measure the impact of product decisions and changes You will use segmentation, cohort analysis , clustering and statistical techniques on A/B testing data to uncover new insights and opportunities. You will research and apply best testing methodology for specific situations include parametric/non-parametric, frequentist vs Bayesian testing You will implement continuous improvements to all aspects of our experimentation program to increase the quality, volume and velocity of experimentation in the organization. You will run sessions to educate us on A/B testing best practices and share the insights with multiple groups You will create dashboards, reports, and analyses that present A/B testing results, explaining what happened and why You will identify and understand several data sources; build tools and services to improve analysis and experimentation throughput, and work with Data Warehouse team to make online and offline data cross platforms available. About you: You will have 7+ years of demonstrated experience at senior level analyzing product and content user behavior for online consumer software product, e.g. online shopping, social site, streaming services, and gaming You will have 5+ years of experience leading experimentation (A/B testing) program in a high test volume environment Analyzing very large datasets with SQL (Redshift, Teradata, Oracle, or MySQL) and R, SAS or other statistical package. You will have experience with one or more testing tools like Optimizely, split.io, or adobe test and target You will have knowledge of statistical methods for common parametric and non-parametric tests You will have expert knowledge of SQL #LI-Remote Company Benefits and Perks: We work hard to embrace diversity and inclusion and encourage everyone at McAfee to bring their authentic selves to work every day. We offer a variety of social programs, flexible work hours and family-friendly benefits to all of our employees. Pension and Retirement Plans Medical, Dental and Vision Coverage Paid Time Off Paid Parental Leave Support for Community Involvement We're serious about our commitment to diversity which is why McAfee prohibits discrimination based on race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation or any other legally protected status. For Colorado Residents the starting salary for this position is $120,000.00

At Centerstone’s Research Institute (CRI), we conduct research to prevent and cure mental illness and addiction. We also work to translate research into meaningful clinical practices and implement research-based strategies in real-world settings, thereby reducing the research-to-practice gap. CRI’s workforce is interdisciplinary and comprised of Physicians, Psychologists, Dissemination and Implementation Scientists, Counselor Educators, Program Evaluators, Social Workers, Public Health Advisors, Biostatisticians, Clinical Transformation Specialists, Design Thinking Experts, and others. We collaborate with Academic Medical Schools, Universities, Statewide Mental Health and Public Health Departments, and Veteran-Serving Institutions in much of our work. Centerstone’s Research Institute is a company of Centerstone, the nation’s largest nonprofit mental health company who provides community-based behavioral health care, substance-abuse treatment and intellectual and developmental disabilities services in Florida, Illinois, Indiana, Kentucky and Tennessee. If you think you’re a good match to join Centerstone’s Research Institute, please review the career opportunity below and submit your application. We look forward to hearing from you!   Job Description: Overview of Centerstone's Research Institute At Centerstone’s Research Institute (CRI), we conduct research to prevent and cure mental illness and addiction. We also work to translate research into meaningful clinical practices and implement research-based strategies in real-world settings, thereby reducing the research-to-practice gap. CRI’s workforce is interdisciplinary and comprised of Physicians, Psychologists, Dissemination and Implementation Scientists, Counselor Educators, Program Evaluators, Social Workers, Public Health Advisors, Biostatisticians, Clinical Transformation Specialists, Design Thinking Experts, and others. We collaborate with Academic Medical Schools, Universities, Statewide Mental Health and Public Health Departments, and Veteran-Serving Institutions in much of our work. Centerstone’s Research Institute is a company of Centerstone, the nation’s largest nonprofit mental health company who provides community-based behavioral health care, substance-abuse treatment and intellectual and developmental disabilities services in Florida, Illinois, Indiana, Kentucky and Tennessee. If you think you’re a good match to join Centerstone’s Research Institute, please review the career opportunity below and submit your application. We look forward to hearing from you! Summary of Job: The Statistician will provide advanced knowledge of scientific methods and statistical analysis to program evaluation and research grants and “prep-to-research” needs within the Research Institute at Centerstone. Core responsibilities include: (a) working with scientific investigators to establish study methods, recruitment and study procedures, and statistical analysis plans; (b) conducting advanced statistical analyses of evaluation and research study outcomes; (c) disseminating outcomes through conferences and publications; (d) disseminating outcomes through media, print, and other non-academic dissemination strategies. Highly organized and ability to work independently. Ability to work across departments in a fast-paced environment focused on innovation, technology, and becoming an international leader in translating research and program evaluation outcomes to meaningful clinical service. Desire to work with a strong, emerging, and collaborative team whose mission is to “deliver care that changes people’s lives.” Supervised By:  Director of Clinical Research Location:  Local or Remote Option Job Qualifications: Minimum M.S. or equivalent in biostatistics, statistics, or a related scientific field required. Minimum one to three years minimum professional experience in clinical research or other academic or social science setting preferred. Demonstrated expertise in quantitative research and statistical software (e.g., R, SAS, SPSS, Stata). Experience in SQL language and mental health services research preferred. Familiarity with using data from electronic health records (EHRs) a plus. Skills in advanced statistical analysis include but not limited to power analysis, structural equation modeling, multilevel modeling, time series, and intent to treat. Expertise demonstrated via first and co-authored publications using advanced methods and analyses preferred. Work samples will be requested upon invitation to interview. Demonstrated expertise or familiarity with Tableau/Qlik Sense/MS Power BI preferred. Essential Duties and Responsibilities: Fulfills “prep-to-research” requests to establish feasibility of research partnerships with external researchers. Collaborates with Centerstone’s Research Institute leaders and academic partners/affiliate investigators to design research and evaluation studies and protocols. Contributes advanced knowledge of scientific methods and statistics to assist with specification of hypotheses, study design, and the analysis plan, including power analysis. Writes sections of funding application(s) (e.g., PCORI, NIH, SAMHSA) in areas consistent with areas of expertise. In areas of funded research, and as applicable, assists with the implementation of studies and protocols. Conducts and reports results of quantitative analyses, including advanced statistical analyses where applicable. Disseminates outcomes via scientific (e.g., conference presentations, publications) and non-scientific (e.g., media, print) mechanisms. Collaborates with the Director of Clinical Research and others to ensure that research at Centerstone is conducted to the highest standards of compliance/privacy/security, scientific rigor, and reproducibility. Facilitates translation of research to practice (e.g., novel treatments for target populations, novel implementation methods) through partnering with the Vice President of Program Evaluation, Director of Clinical Research, Director of Implementation Science, and Director of Clinical Education. Communicates (e.g., training, didactics, supervision, presentations) research information routinely with Research Institute leadership, managers, and staff. Periodically leads training opportunities to disseminate knowledge of scientific methods and data analyses to others within the Research Institute. Upholds professional ethics and maintains compliance with federal regulations. Regular and reliable attendance is required Other Duties and Responsibilities: All other duties as assigned. Physical Demands: Percentage of Time/Frequency Standing 30% Squatting 5% Kneeling 5% Bending 5% Sitting 40% Driving 5% Lifting up to: 25 lbs. Time Type: Full time Centerstone is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, gender, disability, sexual orientation, marital status, or protected veteran status. Time Type: Full time Centerstone is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, gender, disability, sexual orientation, marital status, or protected veteran status. At Centerstone, we use our values as a guide for what we do. Respect, Expertise, Integrity and Empowerment are at the heart of every interaction at Centerstone, and particularly rooted in our beliefs toward diversity and inclusion. Our approach to diversity is simple—it’s about embracing everyone.  Together, we continue to develop an inclusive culture that encourages, supports and celebrates the diverse voices and experiences of our employees. It powers our innovation and connects us closer to each other, to our clients and the communities we serve.  We strive to create a workplace that reflects the growing world around us, and where everyone feels empowered, safe and welcomed.

job_Description: Job Description The Opportunity: Saint Luke’s Healthy System is hiring a Data Scientist for the Data Governance program with experience working with Data Governance tools, SQL, EPIC, SSIS, and various dashboarding tools. This is a remote opportunity. This is a position resourced to the Data Governance program in Enterprise Analytics Team. This individual will work alongside a very supportive leader who is standing up the Data Governance program for the organization. The Data Scientist coordinates the organization’s quality, security, and maintenance of data; defines data assets; builds data lineage maps; works with Data Stewards, stakeholders, and cross-functional groups on establishing and changing policies. This individual is energized and passionate about governance and ensuring sufficient data quality to effectively support the business process and provide insights to all staff and management through thorough testing and validation of data systems to promote trusted data in decision making and supports a system wide data catalog and self-service analytics. Saint Luke’s Health System is a very data driven organization that relies on this team to provide them with the necessary data to make the best decision for our staff, patients, and organization. This is a 100% remote opportunity! The Work:  Assists the data governance team in the implementation and execution of an enterprise data governance framework, policy, and standards.  Supports data needs across the organization by developing, implementing, and enforcing policies that ensure quality, security, and maintenance of data.  Oversees and analyzes strategies designed to enhance data reliability and minimize redundancies.  Develops and manages technical asset inventory, asset relationships, and business and technical metadata.  Helps facilitate the management of the Data Dictionary and the business process flow to support it.  Identifies areas and helps lead efforts for continuous improvement in business processes, technology, or other related processes that impact the quality of data.  Develops control structures to ensure the accuracy and quality of data through all upstream and downstream data channels.  Performs data integrity gap analysis to verify that certain controls are in place over applications that ensure data integrity. Coordinates the resolution of data integrity gaps by working with the business owners and IT.  Defines and builds processes to define and build data lineage of enterprise data assets.  To be successful in this position, you must be passionate about data and have ability to work with both technical and non-technical teams across the organization. You will need to have strong process facilitation, project management, and analytical skills.   3-5 years of SQL experience preferred.  1-3 years of EPIC experience and/or Epic Certifications are preferred.  1-3 years of healthcare experience is preferred.  Strong understanding of reporting tools and technologies, and SharePoint.  Experience in data quality management and/or master data management.  Why Saint Luke’s? Work with supportive leadership who wants to help you grow your skills.  Work in an exciting, high demand, high impact roles impacting patients, staff, and our organization.  Saint Luke’s offers competitive salaries and benefits packages to all eligible employees, click here to find out more.  We believe in creating a collaborative environment where all voices are heard.  We are here for you and will support you in achieving your goals.  We are dedicated to innovation and always looking for ways to improve.  Work 100% Remote  Job Requirements Applicable Experience: 6-9 years Bachelor's Degree (Required) Job Details Full Time Day (United States of America) The best place to get care. The best place to give care . Saint Luke’s 12,000 employees strive toward that vision every day. Our employees are proud to work for the only faith-based, nonprofit, locally owned health system in Kansas City. Joining Saint Luke’s means joining a team of exceptional professionals who strive for excellence in patient care. Do the best work of your career within a highly diverse and inclusive workspace where all voices matter. Join the Kansas City region's premiere provider of health services. Equal Opportunity Employer. We hire only non-tobacco users. Effective November 1st, 2021, full COVID-19 vaccination is a condition of employment for all Saint Luke’s Health System employees unless a medical or religious exemption is approved.

Statistical Programmer II   -   ( 22001605 )  Description Statistical Programmer II  Come discover what our 25,000+ employees already know: work here matters everywhere. We’re a growing and evolving biopharmaceutical industry leader, which means you’ll have endless opportunities to work with experts around the world and build the career you’ve dreamed of. As a part of the Syneos Health team, you’ll help us deliver results for a rewarding reason – we improve patients’ lives around the world. Because to us, a patient isn’t just a number, they’re our family, friends, and neighbors.  Why Syneos Health  #SyneosHealthLife means we’re committed to our Total Self culture – where everyone can authentically be themselves. Our Total Self culture is what unites us globally, and we know every person’s unique contributions make a difference. We believe our success is a direct result of the people who are driving it – you! We value your dedication to care for our customers and patients, so we want to focus on taking care of you. That’s why we offer a comprehensive benefits program encompassing your total health - physical, mental and financial. We are continuously building the company we all want to work for and our customers want to work with. Why? Because when we bring together diversity of thoughts, backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives – we’re able to create a place where everyone feels like they belong.  Job responsibilities  Uses SAS or other software to generate summary tables, data listings, graphs and derived datasets as specified in the statistical analysis plan and programming specifications. Works to ensure that outputs meet quality standards and project requirements. Performs validation programming and works with other Statistical Programmers, Biostatisticians, and other project team members to resolve discrepancies or any findings. Keeps project team members informed of programming progress and issues requiring their attention. Follows applicable SOPs, WIs, and relevant regulatory guidelines (e.g. ICH). Maintains well organized, complete, and up-to-date project documentation, and verification/quality control documents and programs ensuring inspection readiness. Manages scheduling and time constraints across multiple projects, sets goals based on priorities from management, and adapts to timeline or priority changes by reorganizing daily workload. May develop specifications for datasets and outputs according to statistical and Sponsor requirements. Anticipates and addresses potential programming issues, reflects forethought, establishes the basis for efficient programming, accurately defines all variables to be accepted by peer review and sponsor/requestor with little rework. Prepares in advance for internal meetings, contributes ideas, and demonstrates respect for opinions of others. Displays willingness to work with others and assist with projects and initiatives as necessary to meet the needs of the business. Completes project programming activities within timeframe allotted by Lead Statistical Programmer and/or management. May act as the Lead Statistical Programmer, directs the programming activities of other programming personnel and monitors progress on programming deliverables. Assists with the transfer of deliverables. Performs other work-related duties as assigned. Minimal travel may be required.  Qualifications What we’re looking for  Undergraduate Degree, preferably in a scientific or statistical discipline; In lieu of degree, an equivalent combination of education and demonstrated programming experience. Proficiency in programming in SAS or other required software, preferably in a clinical trial environment. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Ability to read, write, speak, and understand English.  Get to know Syneos Health We are the only full-service biopharmaceutical solutions company in the world. That means we bring together the best clinical and commercial minds to create a better, smarter, faster way to get medicines into the hands of patients who need it most. Learn more about Syneos Health.  Additional Information: Tasks, duties, and responsibilities as listed in this job description are not exhaustive. The Company, at its sole discretion and with no prior notice, may assign other tasks, duties, and job responsibilities. Equivalent experience, skills, and/or education will also be considered so qualifications of incumbents may differ from those listed in the Job Description. The Company, at its sole discretion, will determine what constitutes as equivalent to the qualifications described above. Further, nothing contained herein should be construed to create an employment contract. Occasionally, required skills/experiences for jobs are expressed in brief terms. Any language contained herein is intended to fully comply with all obligations imposed by the legislation of each country in which it operates, including the implementation of the EU Equality Directive, in relation to the recruitment and employment of its employees. The Company is committed to compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act, including the provision of reasonable accommodations, when appropriate, to assist employees or applicants to perform the essential functions of the job.  Primary Location :  North America - US Home-Based Job :  Data Services Schedule :  Full-time Travel :  No Employee Status :  Regular

Patch Bio  engineers DNA for gene therapy.  We build technology to make gene therapies safer and more effective, and able to address a broader range of diseases. To do that, we work at the interface of genomics, machine learning, and DNA synthesis. We are a seed-stage, venture-backed biotech startup based in New York City. Role You will be responsible for training ML models using data from our massively parallel assays in order to design large libraries of candidate DNA/RNA. Ideally, you have experience in quantitative genomics applications, including training neural networks to predict functional properties of sequences. Responsibilities Develop our core ML engine for exploring sequence space and designing new candidate elements for large functional screens. Work with our wet lab scientists to ground your designs in experimental considerations. Process NGS data to quantify activity of individual library elements and train predictive models on DNA sequences. Curate relevant external datasets and integrate with our internal data. Qualifications PhD in computational biology, genomics, biomedical engineering, computer science, or equivalent Solid training and expertise in genomics, as evidenced by experience with NGS data. Knowledge of and experience with machine learning, including neural network frameworks (e.g., PyTorch or Tensorflow) and state-of-the-art network architectures. Familiarity with nucleic acid design, including issues related to biochemistry (secondary structure, GC content, repetitiveness), and other factors that affect experimental concerns. Experience working successfully in collaborative, multidisciplinary teams. Desire to work in a rapidly growing company, and a fast-changing environment. Desirable plus Knowledge of gene/protein expression regulation Design of MPRA Experience collaborating with wet lab scientists in experimental design Software engineering best practices, potentially through industry experience Life at Patch In this formative stage of the company, you will have a large impact on many of the key decisions that will define our long-term path. You will join a team of curious and creative experts passionate about making a difference for patients. You will help shape a diverse and inclusive culture, with competitive benefits including great healthcare, generous time off, flexible hours, and access to a 401(k). Our lab is in the heart of SoHo, NYC, but if you don't need to be at the bench you can work from wherever you please. If you share our enthusiasm with working on a fascinating problem at the intersection of synthetic biology and machine learning, that will significantly impact millions of patients, come join us! Contact To learn more, please email  contact@patch.bio .

Strong analytical and analysis skills. Familiar with advanced features of Excel and statistical concepts.  Working knowledge of insurance brokerage or sales workflows and systems an asset.  Experience with Microsoft Azure ML and general project-management skills a plus.  Must be able to manage multiple and rapidly changing, high visibility priorities and projects. JOB DESCRIPTION Job Title:  Statistician  Status:  Exempt Program:  Centerstone’s Research Institute Location:  Nashville, TN (permanent remote work possible with demonstrated experience) Supervised By:  Director, Analytics Job Qualifications:  Minimum M.S. or equivalent in biostatistics, statistics, or a related scientific field required. Minimum one to three years minimum professional experience in clinical research or other academic or social science setting preferred. Demonstrated expertise in quantitative research and statistical software (e.g., R, SAS, SPSS, Stata). Experience in SQL language and mental health services research preferred. Familiarity with using data from electronic health records (EHRs) a plus. Skills in advanced statistical analysis include but not limited to power analysis, structural equation modeling, multilevel modeling, time series, and intent to treat. Expertise demonstrated via first and co-authored publications using advanced methods and analyses preferred. Work samples will be requested upon invitation to interview. Demonstrated expertise or familiarity with Tableau/Qlik Sense/MS Power BI preferred. Summary of Job:  The Statistician will provide advanced knowledge of scientific methods and statistical analysis to program evaluation and research grants and “prep-to-research” needs within the Research Institute at Centerstone. Core responsibilities include: (a) working with scientific investigators to establish study methods, recruitment and study procedures, and statistical analysis plans; (b) conducting advanced statistical analyses of evaluation and research study outcomes; (c) disseminating outcomes through conferences and publications; (d) disseminating outcomes through media, print, and other non-academic dissemination strategies. Highly organized and ability to work independently. Ability to work across departments in a fast-paced environment focused on innovation, technology, and becoming an international leader in translating research and program evaluation outcomes to meaningful clinical service. Desire to work with a strong, emerging, and collaborative team whose mission is to “deliver care that changes people’s lives.” Essential Duties and Responsibilities:  1. Fulfills “prep-to-research” requests to establish feasibility of research partnerships with external researchers. 2. Collaborates with Centerstone’s Research Institute leaders and academic partners/affiliate investigators to design research and evaluation studies and protocols. 3. Contributes advanced knowledge of scientific methods and statistics to assist with specification of hypotheses, study design, and the analysis plan, including power analysis. 4. Writes sections of funding application(s) (e.g., PCORI, NIH, SAMHSA) in areas consistent with areas of expertise. 5. In areas of funded research, and as applicable, assists with the implementation of studies and protocols. 6. Conducts and reports results of quantitative analyses, including advanced statistical analyses where applicable. 7. Disseminates outcomes via scientific (e.g., conference presentations, publications) and non-scientific (e.g., media, print) mechanisms. 8. Collaborates with the Director of Clinical Research and others to ensure that research at Centerstone is conducted to the highest standards of compliance/privacy/security, scientific rigor, and reproducibility. 9. Facilitates translation of research to practice (e.g., novel treatments for target populations, novel implementation methods) through partnering with the Vice President of Program Evaluation, Director of Clinical Research, Director of Implementation Science, and Director of Clinical Education. 10. Communicates (e.g., training, didactics, supervision, presentations) research information routinely with Research Institute leadership, managers, and staff. 11. Periodically leads training opportunities to disseminate knowledge of scientific methods and data analyses to others within the Research Institute. 12. Upholds professional ethics and maintains compliance with federal regulations. Regular and reliable attendance is required Other Duties and Responsibilities:  All other duties as assigned. Job Type: Full-time Pay: $1.00 - $2.00 per year Benefits: 401(k) 401(k) matching Dental insurance Employee assistance program Employee discount Flexible schedule Flexible spending account Health insurance Health savings account Life insurance Paid time off Parental leave Professional development assistance Referral program Relocation assistance Retirement plan Tuition reimbursement Vision insurance Schedule: Monday to Friday Education: Bachelor's (Preferred) Experience: SQL: 3 years (Required) Work Location: Remote

TITLE:  Senior Data Analyst - Global Sourcing Group REPORTS TO:  VP Global Sourcing ABOUT US : Blu Dot (www.bludot.com), an award-winning designer and maker of modern home furnishings, is currently searching for a Senior Data Analyst to join our dynamic and values-driven company.   Company Purpose Inspire a more creative way of living through good design that's good to everyone. Core Values Good design is good . Good design should be reflected in everything we do. Keep it simple.  Strive for economy in all that you do. Everyone is invited to our party.  Treat every individual with respect & dignity. Our glass is half full.  Focus on the positive. Be humble.  We take nothing for granted. Turn it up to 11.  Determine what is expected and do a little more. Stay curious.  Try, learn, improve, repeat. The Global Sourcing group consists of Blu Dot's Supply Chain, Product Management, Product Quality, and Sourcing teams. We are the cog of the wheel for all things product and vendor related at Blu Dot. Our mission is to sustain the health of our growing product collection, own the accuracy of in-stock dates, and maintain a scalable global supplier matrix to support these efforts nimbly and adaptably. ABOUT THE ROLE : Blu Dot is looking for a skilled and dynamic Senior Data Analyst to join the Global Sourcing Group. In this role, you will be responsible analyzing the data generated within the group to tell powerful stories that enable us to make better decisions, improve efficiencies, lower operating costs, and see around the corner. This includes product information, product quality data, and vendor performance data, among others. We are growing quickly, and we need you to not only help us make better data driven decisions today, but build, grow, and maintain a data driven decision platform for the future.    WHO YOU ARE : You are an analyst and storyteller with a blend of data architecture and visualization skills combined with innate curiosity that drives you to peel back the onion layer by layer to uncover hidden stories and opportunities; You are a thinker that thrives on discovery and mining of value from data; You love design but you are data minded and ready to take your talent to a new level; You take pride in your emotional intelligence quotient and strive to foster meaningful professional connections; You are fluent at jumping between personalities, cultures, and geographies, winning the trust, confidence, and respect of others; You think globally and strategically, prioritizing and solving needs today while looking around the corner; You have a high attention to detail and are capable of deftly managing many moving parts; You are curious, entrepreneurial, and you have a continuous learning mindset; You keep calm in the face of chaos, change, pressure, and challenge; You are a great multi-directional communicator; You love solving puzzles and hitting curveballs; You can work independently and manage up; You can lead when needed; You are humble and nice. WHAT YOU WILL DO : You will enable teams within the Group to focus their time on value added actions rather than trying to find the problem themselves; You will partner with cross-functional teams to improve the quality of existing data, bring additional data sources in line, and to aggregate the Group's disparate data sources into a single source of truth; You will identify and communicate business risks and opportunities to leadership while working to formulate initial action plans that mitigate risks and/or maximize opportunities; You will build and maintain visual dashboards to tell stories that measure and impact key areas, including lead times, minimum order quantities, quality, factory performance, factory capacity, etc.; You will use data to enable leading and maintaining the quality and integrity of global supplier performance on all metrics; You will use data to help our teams ensure that we have the manufacturing capacity we need when we need it; You will use data to enable cross-functional teams to achieve margin and financial goals; You will use data to enable our teams to improve inventory levels through vendor performance efficiencies; You will partner with cross-functional teams to drive inventory accuracy; You will make product-status information quickly and easily available to customer-facing teams; You will be a champion of Blu Dot company culture throughout the organization. IDEAL EXPERIENCE/QUALIFICATIONS*: Position is based out of Minneapolis, MN headquarters with a flexible working environment/schedule (no full-time remote work available); Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience with steadily increasing responsibility in an analytics function - ideally in a consumer-facing business; Technical skills include experience with applications and scripting tools like SQL, R, BI-360, Tableau, and Excel; Proven ability to solve business problems and provide clear and analytically-supported solutions; Demonstrated intellectual curiosity. These are 'nice to have' credentials, but we always welcome candidates with unique and diverse backgrounds. We see the value in a wide range of experiences and always love connecting with people excited about opportunities to join Blu Dot.

Overview At the heart of QIAGEN’s business is a vision to make improvements in life possible. We are on an exciting mission to make a real difference in science and healthcare. We are still the entrepreneurial company we started out as and have today achieved a size where we can bring our full power to many initiatives and to our presence across the globe. Our most valuable asset are our employees – more than 5000 in over 35 locations around the world. Our ambition is to ensure we have outstanding and passionate people working in the best teams and we are constantly looking for new talent to join us. There are few players who have shaped the world of modern science and healthcare as much as QIAGEN, and we have only just started. If you are looking to advance your career, are seeking new challenges and opportunities, enjoy working in dynamic and international, diverse teams and want to make a real impact on people’s lives, then QIAGEN is where you need to be. Join us. At QIAGEN, you make a difference every day. Position Description QIAGEN Digital Insights is seeking a talented and motivated scientist to join the QDI Discovery Bioinformatics Services team. The primary responsibility is to provide biological interpretation and curate genomic metadata from various disease areas with a focus on immunology. By collaboratively working with the customer, services team members and internal QIAGEN teams, a successful candidate will integrate acquired knowledge into our efforts to build a large-scale genomic datasets. Main Responsibilities Include Provide professional biology services include NGS data interpretation, data harmonization and metadata curation. Consult with biotech and pharma professionals across multiple therapeutic areas. Review the scientific publications, protocols or other documentation to evaluate study aims, design, methods and research findings. Coordinate the genomic data curation team to extract, QC, annotate, and organize biological/clinical project and sample metadata from various sources. Position Requirements Required: PhD (2+ years of working experience) with strong background in immunology, oncology, or related biomedical fields. Understanding key pathways and mechanisms that may underlie disease processes in immunological diseases, oncology, or related biomedical fields. Knowledge and wet-lab experience with Omic (e.g. microarray, RNA-seq, single cell RNA-seq, DNA-seq, etc) and non-Omic (FACS, ELISA, ELISPOT, clinical measurements, etc) sample preparation and interpretation. Experience with scientific/clinical ontologies and metadata issues. Experience in annotating/curating and handling large data sets with a particular understanding of requirements for auto-processing and long-term data archiving. Preferred: Solid track record of research in biomedical or related areas as demonstrated by publications a plus. Experience with using scripts or programming a plus. Working experience in pharmaceutical industry a plus. Experience with commercial genomics software for NGS data analysis and visualization a plus. Personal Requirements:  Customer-oriented, enjoys working with customers and helping find solutions. Ability to communicate effectively around results and process with biologists and domain experts. Self-motivated with the ability to work independently and demonstrate initiative. Strong ability to multi-task and track ongoing projects. Excellent communication skills and enjoys working in collaborative team environment QIAGEN requires proof of full COVID-19 vaccination as a condition of employment for new hires in all U.S. states other than Montana effective as of September 1, 2021. New hires and candidates will be required to present proof of full COVID-19 vaccination within three business days of start date or upon entry into the office (i.e., for interviews), whichever comes first. This policy is part of QIAGEN’s ongoing efforts to support public health efforts and to ensure the safety and-well-being of its employees, customers, business partners, and community. What we offer At the heart of QIAGEN are our people who drive our success. We act with passion, always challenging the status quo to drive innovation and continuous improvement. We inspire with our leadership and make an impact with our actions. We create a collaborative, safe and engaging workplace which forms the basis for high performing individuals and teams. We drive accountability and entrepreneurial decision-making and want you to excel your growth and shape the future of QIAGEN. QIAGEN is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, and medical conditions related to pregnancy, childbirth, or breastfeeding), sex stereotyping (including but not limited to assumptions about a person’s appearance or behavior, gender roles, gender expression, or gender identity), gender, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, age, mental or physical disability, ancestry, medical condition, marital status, military or veteran status, citizenship status, sexual orientation, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable law. It’s Time For A Change… Your Future Evolves Here At Vital Decisions, a subsidiary of New Century Health, our mission is to ensure that every individual is seen and heard when it comes to their medical care. We help people facing serious health conditions advocate for the experience they want, feel in control of their medical choices, avoid chaos in a crisis, and improve the quality and value of the care they receive. This human-centered mission and focus on personal values is changing the way health care is delivered. Being a catalyst for change, and touching thousands of lives, is the driving force that brings us to work each day.  Our parent company, Evolent Health, was the first organization ever to receive NCQA’s Population Health Program Accreditation, and is consistently recognized as one of Becker’s Healthcare 150 Top Places to Work. We constantly embrace new ideas, challenge ourselves and fail forward. We respect and celebrate individual talents and team wins. We recognize employees that live our values, give back to our communities each year, and are champions for bringing our whole selves to work each day. If you’re looking for a place where your work can be personally and professionally rewarding, don’t just join a company with a mission. Join a mission with a company behind it. What You’ll Be Doing: Who You’ll Be Working With: The Sr. Data Scientist leads Vital Decisions’ analytical and AI strategy to support the design, development and delivery of Vital Decisions’ services to the right individuals at the right time, ensuring medical care that an individual receives during an advanced illness aligns with the individual’s goals and quality of life priorities over time as one progresses toward end of life. Using data sciences skill sets and advanced quantitative analytic methods, the Sr. Data Scientist provides thought leadership and hands on technical expertise in the creation and presenting of analytics and insights that prospectively identify client opportunities, retrospectively demonstrate accurate program performance, and continuously improve program value and impact. The leader in this position will be client-facing and have primary accountability for executing and delivering clear and accurate return on investment (ROI) and related outcomes plausibility analyses. The Sr. Data Scientist serve as a subject matter expert supporting Vital Decisions’ neural network and machine learning strategy to drive product innovation What You’ll Be Doing: The Sr. Data Scientist will support building of AI products in Agile fashion that empower healthcare payers, providers, and members to quickly process medical data to making informed decisions and overall reduce health care costs. Sr. Data Scientist will have the opportunity to lead a team, shape team culture and operating norms because of the fast-paced nature of a high-growth organization. Specially they will lead the following functions: Mortality Modeling: Design AI models to accurately predict individuals who will benefit most from Vital Decisions’ services. End of Life Medical Cost Prediction: Lead, design, and manage research into end of life cost drivers, patterns of medical utilization, actionable segmentations and stratifications  Product and Analytics Road Map: Determine highest ROI product and enhancements to support business objectives Thought Leadership: Develop white papers and studies suitable for publication as a leader in the space; share outcomes and insights at conferences and other forums Return on Investment (ROI): Design and develop new methodologies to measure and evaluate customer return on investment. Opportunity Assessment (OA): Support sales with accurate, clear and timely opportunity assessments for prospective clients – with and the without access to prospect claims data  The Experience You’ll Need (Required): Bachelor’s degree or above in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics or related field. Masters or Doctorate level preferred; and/or extensive work-related experience will be considered 6+ years of Industry experience as a data scientist or Machine learning scientist with 1+ years of leading a Data science team Own the Data science, machine learning and AI products from platforms to systems for model training, versioning, deploying, storage and testing models with creating real time feedback loops to fully automated services Finishing Touches (Preferred): Proven ability to create data analytics and build models using advanced techniques and tools Solid programing skills to develop repeatable analytic and reporting processes Proficiency working with BI and visualization tools Strong process management, critical thinking, problem solving, and decision making Excellent verbal, written communication and presentation skills Excellent time and priority management to support multiple concurrent initiatives and priorities Proven leadership or active participation in peer communities Experience developing content for publications for academic journals Comfort level and ease presenting analysis, results, and insights to health plan clients including C-suite with confidence and credibility; Up to 50% of this role may be client facing Project a positive, solutions oriented attitude along with core company values Technical requirements: Currently, Evolent employees work remotely temporarily due to COVID-19. As such, we require that all employees have the following technical capability at their home: High speed internet over 10 MBPS and, specifically for all call center employees, the ability to plug in directly to the home internet router. These at-home technical requirements are subject to change with any scheduled re-opening of our office locations Evolent Health is an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants equally without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, or disability status. job_title: Data Science and Engineering – Multiple Openings
job_Description: Job Description: This initiative will be supporting a long term federal contract and we are looking for talented Data Science professionals with experience delivering innovative analytics solutions. Available roles include Data Scientist, Data Modeler, Data Architect, Data Engineer, and Data Analyst. These positions are remote to start, but will eventually be onsite in the Huntsville, AL and Washington D.C. areas. Apply today to connect with our team & learn more about this cutting edge opportunity!  Requirements:  4+ years of experience in a Data Scientist/Modeler/Architecture/Engineering/Analyst role Experience working with Enterprise Architecture team, deliver analytics solutions including collecting data from providers, building transformations, persisting within repositories, and distributing to consumers Strong SQL skills with data transformation experience Exposure to Snowflake Experience working in an AWS environment with services such as Lambda, SNS, SQS, Athena, S3, IAM, Glue, VPC, EC2, DynamoDB, CodeBuild, CodeDeploy, Cloud formation  Nice to have:   Responsibilities : The Data Science team will be directly supporting a long-term federal contract providing telecommunications, cloud, and data center services. This team will be implementing and supporting critical technology that will allow secure communication across the globe.

Verge Genomics is a next-generation biopharmaceutical start-up using human genomics to accelerate development of life-saving treatments for neurodegenerative diseases. Our platform uses patient tissue profiling, human genetics, and machine learning to identify new therapeutic gene targets, predict effective drugs, and stratify patient subpopulations for increased clinical success. Verge's approach offers a breakthrough opportunity to identify drugs that dramatically improve patient outcomes and fundamentally lower the cost curve of pharmaceutical development. The newly formed Translational Genomics team is seeking a creative and motivated Data Scientist / Computational Biologist. The Data Scientist will work closely with PhD scientists to design and execute analyses that bring forth actionable insights for the drug discovery process. This position will make extensive use of large internal and external biological datasets, such as high throughput sequencing, proteomics, drug development, toxicity, and chemical tractability databases to aid in prioritization of novel drug targets and biomarkers for severe neurodegenerative diseases. Working with a diversity of biological data types and analyses will provide an exciting and dynamic experience with potential for rapid growth of responsibilities. The position is open to remote work with occasional travel to Verge in South San Francisco.  What You'll Do... Interface with scientists across computational, translational genomics, and target validation/exploratory biology groups to understand unmet needs and help translate human -omics data insights into actionable experimental follow-up and drug target decisions Develop scripts to interrogate large biological datasets, document analyses, perform basic statistical tests, distill sound conclusions, and communicate findings to the scientific team Apply machine learning techniques to identify non-obvious connections between gene, protein, drug, or other feature types and probability of drug target success Proactively identify new data types and analysis methods of value to drug target or biomarker discovery efforts for neurodegenerative diseases  Job Requirements & Technical Competencies Required... MS or PhD degree in computational biology, computer science, data science, statistics, or similar discipline plus zero to two years post-graduate experience, preferably in biotech industry roles Fluency with Python and/or R programming, preferably in cloud-based environments such as a Linux/Unix environment on Amazon Web Services Familiarity with SQL or other relational database querying and theory Experience working with high throughput genomics datasets of at least one type, such as DNA or RNA sequencing from Illumina platforms Ability to communicate technical details to a diverse audience and collaborate across our organization  Job Requirements & Technical Competencies Nice to Have... Fluency with basic concepts of molecular biology and multiple contemporary “-omics” methods is a plus Experience with machine learning techniques and scikit-learn package is a plus Familiarity with software version control (Git repositories) and experience documenting analyses or script development with Jupyter notebooks or similar is a plus Experience working with additional large biological data types, such as proteomics, metabolomics, imaging data, gene ontology databases, etc. is a plus Experience with neurological disease, drug discovery or related research is a plus  Help us revolutionize the way drugs are discovered & developed: The startup nature of Verge Genomics provides multiple growth opportunities into other areas of the company. As one of the early employees at Verge, your work will have a direct impact on the foundation of a groundbreaking new drug development model. In addition to competitive compensation and benefits, we offer perks like unlimited vacation/sick days, on-site gym access, and free lunch.

DMG Data Scientist (with Remote Option) The Rawlings Company is looking for hard-working, talented people who share our commitment to excellence to join the Data Mining Group within our IT team. The Rawlings Company   has successfully provided cost containment services to the largest health insurers in the country for more than 40 years and continues to grow as an industry leader. Our Culture is focused on: The guiding principle of doing the right thing. Caring for our employees and taking pride in the work they do. Providing recognition and financially rewarding employees for their success. Our Values are: Integrity and Trust Customer Service Excellence Innovation Diversity and Inclusion Honoring our Veterans and Their Service Job Summary The Data Scientist supporting the Drug Payment Integrity Division. The candidate will identify statistical relationships, via modeling, then analytically test business assumptions along with performing hypothesis tests on those assumptions. A diverse background of experience with techniques will be crucial to providing alternative approaches. Results will be implemented into business processes to improve growth in revenue and profitability. Hours : Day shift, 40-hour work weeks. Flexible schedule options available between 7am - 7pm after six months of employment. Setting:  Professional office environment (with remote option available outside a 70-mile radius from La Grange, KY). Compensation:  We offer a competitive total compensation program. Our comprehensive benefit package includes health and dental benefits, short-term disability plans, 401k with company matching, paid time off policy and more. We also offer an onsite gym, café, and coffee shop. Responsibilities Support DMG with Analytical solutions to enhance mining efforts. Develop Statistical models to achieve business goals. Develop reporting solutions to allow the business to monitor modeling and mining efforts. Provide in-depth explanations of numerical solutions to management. Communicate continuously with Data Mining Group leadership on new project and report assignments. Learn the Rawlings’ business model. Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in computer science, physics, mathematics or other science related fields. Minimum of five years of SQL experience. Minimum of three years of Data Science experience or other relevant experience. Previous Python software development experience. Extensive experience in classification models. Minimum of three years building statistical models, with both classical and machine learning approaches. Must be highly detailed and comfortable spending significant time debugging data. Must work well with a team. This person will be part of a small focused team. Have a wide range of experience with many analytical techniques. Must be comfortable with experimentation. Experience within the health insurance industry is preferred. Physical Requirements  Frequently remains in sitting position for long periods of time to perform duties Frequently concentrates for long periods of time, paying close attention to detail Frequently uses and views the computer using fingers, hands, and vision Frequently works in a well-lit, tempered environment Occasionally moves through office to communicate with other employees Equal Employment Opportunity.
