job_title: Image Analyst, AI - REMOTE: US, UK, EU
job_Description: Image Analyst, AI – REMOTE: US, UK, EU  Classification: FLSA Exempt (US Only)  Reports To: Principal Scientist,  AI Collaborations Note:  Indica Labs is recruiting for an image analyst to work remotely in the United States, United Kingdom, or European Union. The job will be directly involved in annotating digital pathology images prior to processing them through Indica Labs’ HALO AI algorithms. This work will play a key role in developing artificial intelligence (AI) algorithms as part of Indica Labs’ clinical portfolio. The successful candidate will become part of a growing team within Indica Labs that design cutting-edge and innovative AI algorithms for digital pathology. These algorithms will benefit both patients, clinicians and those working in the medical industry. The field of AI analysis in digital pathology is at an exciting time where we are beginning to witness these algorithms being used in clinical practice. The successful candidate should be an enthusiastic and collaborative worker that is passionate about developing image analysis research into tools to impact the healthcare system. Knowledge of histology and histopathology is required, but not knowledge of any computing programming or computer science. Summary  This is a scientific and technical position responsible for performing scientific analysis on digital pathology images with appropriate presentation of key data to the stakeholders.   Duties and Responsibilities   Performs end-to-end histo-pathology image analysis studies on projects involving Indica Labs’ clinical and academic collaborators.  Meets with collaborators to identify study requirements and propose study design.  Conducts image analysis tasks using Indica Lab’s suite of software on digital pathology images; including image annotations, image analysis algorithm training and data analysis.  Maintains regular status communications, where appropriate, with collaborators and Indica team throughout a study’s execution.  Prepares study reports for internal and external projects and present results, data, and findings.  Responsible for the appropriate accessing and handling of electronic Protected Health Information (PHI) as outlined by policy and the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA)  This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required of the employee. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change, or new ones may be assigned at any time with or without notice   Minimum Qualifications   Bachelor’s Degree in relevant biomedical science discipline  One (1) year experience in image analysis or digital pathology  Basic knowledge of histology and histopathology  Indica Labs is a federal contractor, so US candidates should expect a requirement for full vaccination against COVID-19  Authorization to work in the applicant’s current home country (Indica Labs, Inc. does not sponsor work visas).   Preferred Qualifications   Masters degree in relevant biomedical science discipline  More than one (1) years working experience with cancer histopathology   Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities   Ability to deliver presentations to small and large scientific audiences.  Soft skills, with a passion for providing superior customer service  Basic skills in Information Technology (IT) and network knowledge  Ability to provide complex data in an easy to understand format  Critical thinking skills  Ability to work for extended periods of time using computer screens   Location  This position reports to our headquarters in Albuquerque, New Mexico, however all work will be performed remotely in the applicant’s home state or country. The job may require some international travel. Working Conditions and Physical Effort   No, or limited physical effort required  No, or limited exposure to physical risk  Work is normally performed in a typical interior/office work environment   Indica Labs, Inc. is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We take pride in providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants regardless of their race, color, creed, religion, gender, age, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by state, federal, or local law. Additionally, it is standard company policy to provide reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals who have protected disabilities to the extent required by applicable laws. All candidates will be required to submit unofficial transcripts as a condition of application. Due to the nature of our business, and to meet United States Federal, State, and international requirements, final selected candidates must pass a background check for employment.

Experience with Database administration and optimization (preferred). Experience in advanced data analytics, predictive analytics using rendering tools like Tableau, PowerBI, etc. Experience in agile software development and software designing and architecture. job_title: Natural Language Processing Senior Manager - Evernorth
job_Description: Remote, Work from Home, United States Natural Language Processing (NLP) is essential technology in today’s healthcare environment. Our Sr. Manager will work closely with numerous Strategic partners to understand their most pressing business problems. Together, the insights gleaned from NLP-augmented adjudicated claims data, call center data and other sources provide new ways for our organization to respond quickly and with material impact on the most critical priorities affordability, simplicity and predictability. The NLP Sr. Manager within Global Data & Analytics will interface with Business Partners in Data Science Center of Excellence, IT, Engineering and Marketing, who are integral to implementing innovative solutions. The NLP Sr. Manager will promote the use of NLP/ Deep Learning techniques to solve omni channel business problems and where appropriate engage with vendors or internal partners to test NLP related software and techniques in order to leapfrog Evernorth’s use of agent interaction data. The incumbent will also leverage the Data Science Center of Excellence to solve business problems that require a productionalized/iterative solution. Resulting insights and actions would be aimed at increasing sustainable digital penetration and use, reducing call volume and handle time, lowering health costs, and improving health outcomes. In addition, this person will create frameworks for addressing repetitive or similar business problems. This position is with Evernorth, a new business within the Cigna Corporation.  Responsibilities: Manage and mentor team of analysts on framing business problems and methodology for delivering solutions. Utilize analytical techniques (e.g. NLP, Machine Learning, Neural Nets, Logistic Regression, Cluster Analysis,) to create and size actionable insights /recommendations to achieve Operations strategic initiatives Extract and analyze Big Data leveraging tools such as R, Python, SAS and SQL Partner closely with Call and Claim Service Operations team and other enabling organizations Design test v control designs and reads to pilot solutions Summarize and communicate complex technical results and recommendations simply and concisely so that they can be easily consumed and embraced by business leaders.  Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree required, as well as an advanced degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Biostatistics, Econometrics, Economics, Finance, or Data Science 3+ years of related analytical work experience in the Healthcare, Financial Services, Technology, Telecommunications or related industry 3+ years hands on experience with Natural Language Processing, Machine Learning and deep learning/ neural nets (CNNs, RCNNs LSTMs) techniques, statistical techniques and test design 3+ years of experience in managing technical staff Thrive in a matrix organization Advanced user of Python/R/SAS/TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras, Spark required Working knowledge of contact data and channel operations -- IVR, Digital, Chat, EDI, App, Call Transcript, Survey data Experience with leveraging call and chat transcripts using NLP processing and machine learning Hands on experience with digital data (clickstream, adobe, Site Catalyst) Experience working for a large enterprise with structured and unstructured data sources and creating clarity from the ambiguity T his role is work at home / flex which allows most work to be performed at home. Employees must be fully vaccinated if they choose to come onsite. For this position, we anticipate offering an annual salary of $153,500 - $255,800, depending on relevant factors, including experience and geographic location. This role is also anticipated to be eligible to participate in an annual bonus plan. Helping our customers achieve healthier, more secure lives is at the heart of what we do. While you take care of our customers, we’ll take care of you through a comprehensive benefits program that helps you be at your best. Starting on day one of your employment, you’ll be offered several health-related benefits including medical, vision, dental, and best in class well-being and behavioral health programs. We also offer 401(k) with company match, company paid life insurance, tuition reimbursement, a minimum of 18 days of paid time off per year and dozens of corporate discounts on essentials you use every day. For more details on our employee benefits programs, please visit the “Life at Cigna” tab on our careersite: www.cigna.com/careers About Evernorth Evernorth, Cigna Corporation’s health services segment, exists to elevate health for all. We're building on our legacy and redefining health care as we know it. Unbiased in how we think, we create without limitation. We partner without constraints, deliver value differently and act in the interest of humanity. Solving across silos, closing gaps in care, and empowering clients, customers, and people everywhere to move onward and upward. When you work with us, you’ll be empowered to solve the problems others don’t, won’t or can’t. Join us. What difference will you make? About FightCamp FightCamp is a connected at-home boxing gym. With FightCamp, you get access to world-class boxing and kickboxing trainers, studio-quality equipment, and performance-tracking technology — all from the comfort of your home. The key to a FightCamp workout lies in our Punch Tracking technology — we allow you to measure every strike, deliver real-time stats and fuel your competitive side. The FightCamp iOS app holds over 1000 workouts, drills and adds more than 12 new classes each week. Our customer base has grown to over 30,000 members throughout the US, with over 1.2 billion punches thrown, in just over two years. We’ve quickly become one of the fastest-growing players in the ever-expanding in-home fitness market, with sales growing 30 times over the last two years. To date, we have raised over $90M in venture capital. We’re committed to shaping the future of at-home fitness and are well-positioned for substantial growth. FightCamp (formerly known as Hykso) was launched out of Y-Combinator in March 2016. * What We Value* * Collaborative team players with a growth mindset High attention to detail with a focus on quality and user experience Excellent critical thinking, problem-solving, and communication skills Proactive self-starters * About the Role of Senior Machine Learning Engineer* As a Senior Machine Learning Engineer at FightCamp, you will play a key role in building the next generation of the FightCamp app. You’ll have the opportunity to solve challenging problems, work with the latest technologies, and extensively contribute to the design and implementation of machine learning algorithms. In this role, you will collaborate closely with the CTO, Director of Engineering, Product Managers, and web team. You’ll have the opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies in a fast-paced environment. What You Will Do Design and implement scalable AI and machine learning algorithms Write efficient, performant, and maintainable code Ability to efficiently store and retrieve large volumes of data Develop feature processing for machine learning models Implement processing algorithms on real-time sensor data Collaborate closely with data scientists to invent new algorithms Ability to understand and provide insight into human motion Deliver real-time feedback Requirements 3-5 years of experience Strong knowledge of Python, Kotlin/Java, TensorFlow Experience with databases, SQL or NoSQL Experience with signal processing or machine learning algorithms Perks & Benefits * Medical, dental, and vision insurance Competitive compensation package with stock options at a high-growth startup Company-sponsored 401(k) plan Paid holidays and sick days Flexible PTO policy Free lunches and free snacks (even for remote work) Fitness subsidies One day, monthly, dedicated to continuous learning/fun projects Child care allowance * Come Work With Us* Want your work to have a significant impact on other people’s lives and well-being? At FightCamp, your work will not only shape who you will become professionally but personally. We’re funded, generating revenues, and one of the most dedicated teams you’ll find. Our mentality is simple. Work smart, play hard. We are a results-driven team that values autonomy and individual responsibility over hierarchy. We are looking for other A+ players to join our team. Shape the future of at-home fitness with us. Job Type: Full-time

job_title: Senior Manager, Machine Learning Digital Quality Management System
job_Description: BeiGene continues to grow at a rapid pace with challenging and exciting opportunities for experienced professionals. When considering candidates, we look for scientific and business professionals who are highly motivated, collaborative, and most importantly, share our passionate interest in fighting cancer. Position Summary: The position’s primary purpose is to: Ensure any Data Science and Machine Learning (ML) used within BeiGene are following applicable GXP regulations To advance the utilization of ML to unlock actionable insights from data to provide efficient solutions to the Quality, Compliance, Audit, Learning & Performance functions, and broader R&D stakeholders Application of deep learning methods to problems and support in clinical studies as well as early discovery and research, adverse event prediction Ensure data access, application of appropriate analysis methods to unlock information and meaningful visualization and interpretation of information to derive actionable insights Develop and support ML and Business Intelligence solutions Essential Functions of the job: The role will require cross-functional interactions and collaborations across the enterprise. S/He will act as a key advisor and influencer and be required to both establish and apply new ML methods to specific problem domains within various functions. Quality lead for key ML pilots to ensure successful completion and develop plans to integrate capabilities into the normal early clinical development process Influence, from quality perspective, the development of BGNE’s overall ML objectives and long-range goals Through Artificial Intelligence/ML, identify risks before they occur and enable Quality Assurance to achieve continuous improvements Responsible for serving as a liaison with the Data, internal and external data partners, monitoring and meeting agreed upon project(s) milestones, escalating issues as needed to appropriate Data vendor and estimating resources needs. He/She communicates issues, as necessary, to senior management and collaborates with clinicians and biostatisticians as needed. This includes communication and quality oversight of the vendor. He/She has diverse problem-solving skill and is comfortable representing the analytical programming perspective to the Project Team and is often the sole functional representative Development of new and novel Deep learning methods for reinforcement, learning, knowledge transfer and generative methods Develop the software tools and library for application of deep learning methods, and train other colleagues within BGNE to develop and use the tools in their applications Possess in-depth knowledge of multiple real-world data assets and share information about these data to business partners and the IT team. Provides guidance and support to business and quality system process owners through accessing, analyzing and visualizing data relevant to their process or network to identify weak signals and improvement opportunities. Participates on cross functional teams, projects and/or programs with the goal of systematically integrating data, deriving insights and automating processes. Partner across the entire value chain at BGNE R&D to commercial manufacturing to interact and learn from teams involved in business process execution, automation tools, and data generation while ensuring applicable regulations adherence. Successfully executing projects allowing for identification of insights and improvement opportunities as well as ultimately deriving substantial business value from operational data. Job Category Products and Technology Job Details GM, Einstein & Unified Data Services  As we enter the new Digital age, Salesforce will empower our customers to leverage the power of their 1st party data to deliver trusted, data-driven, and intelligent customer experiences across the entire Customer 360.  We are seeking a senior product leader with the technical experience, passion, and entrepreneurial spirit to lead the strategy and execution of a unified Data and AI platform. The GM of Einstein and Unified Data Services will be responsible for leading the teams responsible for delivering a unified data platform that leverages the power of Einstein across the entire Salesforce portfolio. This leader will partner closely with engineering, marketing, and our Core cloud leaders to bring this vision to life to drive value for our customers. This leader will have a proven track-record of leading distributed teams at a large enterprise, building and executing on a roadmap that balances the short-term needs of the business and medium to long term needs that fuels future business success, and building best-in-class teams. This role will require managing a high performance team of product managers to engage customers, define strategy, set road-maps, and work across engineering to execute and ship.   Responsibilities: Develop vision, roadmap, and execution to deliver unified data & artificial intelligence services that enable customers to unlock data across the entire Customer 360. Responsible for leading a team of product managers through all aspects of product life cycle. This includes: market needs, product vision and strategy, roadmap creation and communication, release planning, requirements gathering, functional specification all the way through to customer enablement and success. Work with Salesforce portfolio products to develop and execute a go-to market strategy & plan in collaboration with marketing, sales, sales enablement, sales support and product teams. Maintain a strong, cohesive and collaborative culture across product and engineering teams and across organizational boundaries. Focus on continuous improvement of product planning and delivery practices across the organization. Develop and nurture a high performance team of product managers and link performance to overall business objectives. Leverage market analysis, competitive knowledge, jobs to be done framework, and customer research to define product roadmap. Champion and evangelize new capabilities and solutions with marketing, sales, support, professional services, partners and customers. Actively participate in industry events, customer briefings, advisory boards, and social media communications. Work with partners to ensure i nteroperability with our customer’s existing data landscape will be an important point of consideration as we move more deeply into the data space.   The ideal candidate will have: Passion for Salesforce, our values, and especially the role of Data in our future. Experience leading distributed teams of over 1000+ people Ability to balance short term needs of the business and medium-to-long term innovation that delivers long term success and customer value Extensive B2C experience and / or experience delivering products that drive personalized and relevant experiences that are driven by data and AI Strong technical acumen and expertise of Data, Artificial Intelligence, and Machine Learning A strong sense of vision and ability to mobilize product and engineering teams to continue innovating to drive market leadership and customer success in a fast paced technology space. Deep understanding of the data market, how its evolving, and how Salesforce can compete Demonstrated ability to inspire, align, and enable a large geographically dispersed team across all corporate functions in order to drive a successful business. Understand and believe in the unique characteristics of our approach to developer agility and low code / no-code application development. A successful track record of working effectively in a highly matrixed and fast-growing organization. A strong and proven commitment to diversity and equality, building inclusive teams, and inclusive & accessible products. A broad range of experiences across sales, marketing, product management, and engineering. Ability to build and grow an outstanding leadership team and organization.   DESIRED EXPERIENCE/SKILLS: 15+ years of experience leading a business or product line in platform or cloud services. 10+ years experience within a software or technology company, preferably managing the product of the entire business or large business unit. Demonstrated leadership experience in an enterprise technology organization. Built or led a technology start-up. Strong marketing or sales experience, specifically in the successful launch of new products. Exceptional communicator, comfortable presenting to both business and technology executives. Exceptional leadership capabilities. Proven ability to grow, develop, and retain top technical and product management talent. Very strong interpersonal skills, with demonstrated ability to work effectively and collaboratively with diverse team members and external parties. Deep understanding of development processes and methodologies. Track record of driving results within a matrixed business environment. Strong general management and strategic planning skills combined with expertise in establishing and leading business planning, operational , financial and processes. Undergraduate degree; relevant technical or business (MBA) post-graduate degree is preferred. For Colorado-based roles: Minimum annual salary of $220,000. You may also be offered a bonus, restricted stock units, and benefits. More details about our company benefits can be found at the following link:  https://www.getsalesforcebenefits.com/ LI-Y Accommodations If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form . Do you get excited by the challenge of scaling a fast-growing company through strong analytics insight and data science solutions? Do you find it rewarding to navigate through complexity and solve problems nobody had solutions before? Are you enthusiastic about experimentation, fast learning and innovation? We’re looking for a senior leader to grow a high-performing  Workforce Analytics team  with a passion to solve business problems with advanced analytics. You and your team will be the strategic partners with senior business leaders, identify opportunities and problems, test and measure hypotheses, build analytics and data science solution, and surface insights to drive transformative changes. More about you The perfect candidate will be a seasoned people leader with a background in applied statistics, economics or a related quantitative field. You have strong business acumen, you are comfortable with ambiguity and complexity, and you have experience working with senior leaders and cross functional teams. You are a self-starter, a strategic thinker, a data-driven problem solver, and a humble learner. You have demonstrated success in using data science to drive understanding, progression, and decision making for large organizations. You have domain knowledge in workforce analytics and people analytics.  In this role you will get to: Hire, lead, and grow a team of data scientists with great technical skills, business acumen, and value fit Partner with senior leaders to identify business opportunities and build KPIs Partner with cross-functional teams (program management, workforce planning team, etc) to drive transformative initiatives and make impact Be the thought leader to build analytics strategy, provide transparency of roadmap, and drive sprint planning Build shared vision, empower a team of missionaries, and deliver high quality outcome Drive actionable analytics insights, build data science solutions, and measure impact Manage roadmapping, sprint planning, stakeholder engagement, and remove blockers when needed Be a great communicator to share complexed ideas simple, advocate team's work and coach data storytelling  On your first day, we'll expect you to have: 8+ years experience as a people leader with proven success 15+ years experience in analytics and data science field Success at hiring, managing, and growing a global team remotely Strong business acumen and strategic thinking - when there is complexity and ambiguity, you can help your team identify the right problem to solve Success at building a culture of data-informed decision making, fast learning and innovation Strong communication skills to tell data stories to non-technical audience Strong technical background in statistics, measurement, experimentation, modeling, SQL, R/Python, data instrumentation Experience applying advanced analytics knowledge to the real world Roadmap planning, sprint planning, and project management skills You have domain knowledge in workforce analytics and people analytics  It's great, but not required, if you have: Experience in B2B, customer support, customer success Experience in product analytics, people analytics Experience with large data sets and distributed computing (Hive/Hadoop) Experience in using Jira, Team Central, Confluence to manage and share team's work  More about our team We are a growing analytics and project delivery team located in multiple regions across the globe. We challenge each other constantly to improve our work and ask hard questions. We're direct, focused, and demand excellence, but there's laughter in every meeting because we thoroughly enjoy the work we do and the impact it has. We're constantly growing, learning, adapting, and trying new things. BBQ, tacos, and coffee are a few of our favorite things. More about our benefits Whether you work in an office or a distributed team, Atlassian is highly collaborative and yes, fun! To support you at work (and play) we offer some fantastic perks: ample time off to relax and recharge, flexible working options, five paid volunteer days a year for your favourite cause, an annual allowance to support your learning & growth, unique ShipIt days, a company paid trip after five years and lots more. More about Atlassian Creating software that empowers everyone from small startups to the who’s who of tech is why we’re here. We build tools like Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket, and Trello to help teams across the world become more nimble, creative, and aligned—collaboration is the heart of every product we dream of at Atlassian. From Amsterdam and Austin, to Sydney and San Francisco, we’re looking for people who want to write the future and who believe that we can accomplish so much more together than apart. At Atlassian, we’re committed to an environment where everyone has the autonomy and freedom to thrive, as well as the support of like-minded colleagues who are motivated by a common goal to: Unleash the potential of every team. Additional Information We believe that the unique contributions of all Atlassians is the driver of our success. To make sure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience we never discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. If your experience looks a little different from what we’ve identified and you think you can rock the role, we’d love to learn more about you. Learn more about Atlassian’s culture, interviewing flow, and hiring process by checking out our Candidate Resource Hub.

R&D Statistician  Location: Lenexa, KS  Job Summary and Purpose:   This position is responsible for the oversight of statistics, including assistance in experimental design, conducting statistical analysis and writing portions of study reports submitted to government agencies for biological and pharmaceutical products. Further, this position is expected to contribute to a global statistics community.  This position will perform statistical analysis based on reliable data provided by the data management team, in compliance with current scientific knowledge, quality and regulatory requirements, acting as a project team member.  Responsibilities and Key Duties:   Analysis and Trial Design   Conduct statistical and descriptive analysis for research teams in support of clinical studies.   Conduct optimal statistical designs conforming to regulations and provide strategic statistical input to the regulatory submissions.   Facilitate statistical tests, such as ELISA parallelism, prevented fraction, and mitigated fraction.   Design and implement various predictive modeling strategies.   Carry out research to optimize current statistical analysis procedures for better efficiency and accuracy.   Work closely with other departments in the company and provide statistical support for different teams, as needed.   Perform trial randomization and blinding, as needed   Benchmark current practices vs. competitors and trends to keep up-to-date knowledge   Act as a project team member, bringing expertise and support for the success of assigned projects  Development and Writing  Develop and maintain statistical software, including programming, testing, and documenting statistical programs, for multipurpose analytical techniques for the R&D department.   Incorporate data analysis results into study reports submitted to the government.  Global Statistics  Active member of global statistics community   Expected to remain current with relevant literature   Participation in Ceva Global Statistical meetings   Work in collaboration with other statisticians on transversal topics  Core Competencies:   Shape solutions out of complexity - Questions the way things are done   Client focus - Installs customer focus within entity   Collaborate with empathy - Proactively cooperates   Engage and develop - Drives conditions for optimal performance   Drive ambition and accountability - Holds self and others accountable for high performance   Influence others - Consciously tries to persuade  Technical / Functional Competencies:    Mastery of the corporate tools & software related to position and capacity to train others   Ability to act as subject matter expert and transfer knowledge to others   Ability to organize, enter data an monitor for consistency  Global knowledge, and understanding of the SOPs and local regulations, including writing SOPs as needed   Train and transfer skills of position in global community in process of continuous improvement  Propose appropriate statistical methodologies based on regulatory requirements  Qualifications:  Education – Minimum MS in Statistics/Biostatistics with 5+ years of relevant experience, PhD with 1+ years of relevant experience preferred. Other  Advanced knowledge of experimental design, linear/non-linear models and their extensions, mixed effects models, categorical data analysis and familiarity of commonly used machine learning/data mining techniques.   Strong knowledge of statistical programming languages, such as R, SAS or STATA is required.   Working knowledge of a general-purpose programming language, e.g., C/C++ is preferred.  Strong knowledge of FDA and USDA regulations and industry standards applicable to the development phases, design, analysis of clinical trials and regulatory submissions is preferred.  Physical Requirements:    Ability to read, write legibly and communicate in English  Capable of working extensively with computers  Tasks frequently require prolonged mental and visual concentration  Working Conditions:    Remote working from home is negotiable after candidate is fully onboarded in the role  Travel Required:    N/A  This job description is intended to convey information essential to understanding the scope of the job and general nature and level of work performed by job holders within this job.   This job description is not intended to be an exhaustive list of qualifications, skills, duties and responsibilities or working conditions associated with the job.   This job description is not an employment contract.   Ceva reserves the right to modify job duties and/or job descriptions at any time to meet the needs of the business. VEVRAA Federal Contractor   **Ceva is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, genetic information, actual or perceived sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Ceva encourages men and women, members of all racial and ethnic groups, individuals with disabilities and veterans to apply. 669B

Company Overview WarnerMedia is a powerful portfolio of iconic entertainment, news, and sports brands. We bring people, technology, and the world’s best storytellers together to drive culture and meaningful connection. We believe the enduring power of stories can open our eyes to the world, to each other, and to new and different perspectives.  CNN invented cable news in 1980, defined online news in 1995 and is now taking the next step in expanding what news can be by launching CNN+. With an unrivaled global reach, storytelling, and world class talent, we are building CNN+, a streaming product that will grow the reach and scope of the CNN brand in a way that no one else is doing.  We are journalists, designers and technologists, all united by a powerful mission to inform, engage and empower the world. Join the most trusted and recognized name in news as we build our next chapter. Join us. Shape your story here. We are looking for Mobile Engineers to help us significantly scale how we experiment, build, and collaborate on ML-based data products. We are currently optimizing our first ML platform to help accelerate our experimentation and model production, and we would love for you to join us in making a huge impact on the overall organization. This is a remote position, and candidates who live near a CNN office are welcome but not required to work from an office as desired. Here’s some of the problems you’ll be helping us solve: The news cycle moves fast. What can we learn from readers’ engagement with breaking news to recommend writing or video which deepens their understanding? How can we create a virtuous recommender system which drives diversity in people’s reading habits? What’s the best way for a machine learning group to work closely with journalists and editors to keep our audience engaged and informed? What are the right UI/UX patterns to follow to provide personalized content while also making sure our news feeds contains the most important top stories? What You’ll Do Develop new personalized UI/UX experiences in CNN’s iOS and Android apps Architect and build intuitive, simple and elegantly designed mobile features and apps that people want to use Author, test, review, and optimize production-level code while executing best practices in version control and code integration Work with mobile engineers on our team to make sure our experiences and experiments are aligned Collaborate with engineers in our Core News and other client-facing teams to roll out and maintain machine learning powered surfaces throughout the app Collaborate with machine learning and software engineers, ops, product teams and other key stakeholders and drive ML-powered features from conception to completion Who You Are You're well-rounded with experience on web and mobile technologies, with demonstrated ability to develop new innovative applications as well as maintain and iterate on existing apps and code You understand the constraints of working with a growing team and thrive in an environment that is fast-paced and sometimes scrappy. You understand that working with user data in recommendations or other systems comes with a host of privacy and security concerns, and you are both creative and principled in how you approach it. You can work independently when needed, and contribute to multiple team projects simultaneously. You have a deep curiosity and are proactive in seeking innovative solutions to business problems. You believe in iterating quickly, and removing any and all obstacles that slow down turning ideas into deployable code. You are an efficient communicator with your team and collaborators. You know when and why to offer feedback, to get help, or to advocate for your ideas. Things You Should Know Demonstrated full-stack (mobile native, mobile hybrid, mobile web, and API) experience leveraging container and cloud technologies such as React Native, Swift, Kotlin, NodeJS, Docker, Kubernetes, and serverless frameworks How to work in a shared client codebase with multiple teams working on multiple features, while prioritizing and representing your own team’s work in cross-functional planning Mobile DevOps and CI/CD tools and best practices Best practices in software engineering such as testing, working with a source control system like Git, reviewing code General familiarity with SQL and database technologies How to work in cloud computing platforms (AWS) Things You Might Know Experience with Terraform, AWS CloudFormation or a similar IaC (infrastructure-as-code) tool NoSQL, columnar, and/or graph database proficiency How to work in collaboration with machine learning engineers, data scientists, product owners, and analysts to instrument an app in a way that collects the right data for learning Experience building flexible software architecture to accommodate multiple stakeholders and business needs If you don’t know any of these, that’s OK- you’ll get the opportunity to learn them on the job once you join! The Perks Exclusive WarnerMedia events and advance screenings Paid time off every year to volunteer for eligible employees Access to well-being tools, resources, and freebies Access to in-house learning and development resources Part of the WarnerMedia family of powerhouse brands Warner Media, LLC and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity employers. Qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.

About Canoo: About Canoo  Canoo’s mission is to bring EVs to Everyone and build a world-class team to deploy this sustainable mobility revolution. We have developed breakthrough electric vehicles that are reinventing the automotive landscape with pioneering technologies, award-winning designs, and a unique business model that spans all owners in the full lifecycle of the vehicle. Canoo is starting production in 2022 and is distinguished by its pioneering and experienced team of technologists, engineers, and designers. With offices around the country, the company is scaling quickly and seeking candidates who love to challenge themselves, are motivated by purpose, and possess a strong desire to get things done. The “Canoo Way”  Canoo’s success is the direct result of our disciplined application of our core operating principles and drills, which are based on three main principles: Think 80/20 (“Important versus less important”), Act 30/30 (“Reduce waste and increase output”), and Live 90/10 (“We have each other’s back”). We hire based on “MET” - Mindset, Equipment and willingness to Train - and seek individuals that take accountability and deliver results while being Humble, Hungry to succeed, and Hunting for opportunities to win. We train our team to engage with each other by modulating between their intellect (iQ) and emotional intelligence (eQ), applying Facts, Finesse, and Force when they communicate. The principles and drills of the CANOO Way have been fundamental to our success, our ability to grow, continuously improve, innovate and are at the core of our day-to-day operations. Overview: Plan, design, build and operationalize data and machine learning pipelines on a modern cloud data and ML stack. Work in an agile team environment across many business verticals to build and operate a data and ML platform to collect, model, integrate and make data assets and data products available for self-service analytics, AI/ML and API use cases. This position will report to the Data Office. Responsibilities: Design and build machine learning pipelines using statistical and machine learning techniques on a modern cloud data stack. Support production operations of a cloud-based data platform supporting multiple data assets, data products, models, and API’s. Work with Data Scientists and Data Engineers to prepare datasets and engineer features for model training and deployment. Build data and ML pipelines leveraging best practices and integrating with data management tools and frameworks for security, governance, quality, and compliance. Work with business partners across many verticals to write Agile stories for data and ML engineering features. Qualifications: Required Experience Bachelor’s degree in an Engineering or Quantitative discipline. 4 or more years of experience in a hands-on data and ML engineering role. Deep experience with one or more AI and ML frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-Learn and/or Keras. Advanced level knowledge of SQL. Advanced level experience with Python. Working knowledge of one or more cloud platform data and analytics services like AWS. Experience with one or more cloud data warehouse platforms like Snowflake or RedShift. Experience with streaming frameworks like Kafka. Experience working in a fast-paced team environment. Experience working on agile data analytics teams. Experience building in and measuring data quality. Ability to learn and apply new technologies, methods, and patterns. Experience with containerization. Experience with CI/CD. Automotive industry experience. Preferred   Experience Masters in an Engineering or Quantitative discipline. AI/ML certifications on AWS, Google, or Azure. Snowflake experience and certifications. Experience working with high velocity streaming data. Experience with automotive telematics, video and ADAS data. AI/ML experience in Automotive industry. Experience with edge computing. Travel Requirements Travel limited to 10%. Physical Requirements for Non-Physical Positions While performing the duties of this job, employees may be required to sit for prolonged periods of time, occasionally bending or stooping, lifting up to 10 pounds, and prolonged periods of computer use. Reasonable Accommodations Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the position. What's Cool About Working Here...: Meaningful, challenging work that will redefine automotive landscape and make EVs available to everyone Comprehensive Health Insurance Equity Compensation Flexible Paid Time Off Casual workplace with an unbelievable feeling of energy Canoo is an equal opportunity-affirmative action employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, past or present military service or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.   We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Any unsolicited resumes or candidate profiles submitted in response to our job posting shall be considered the property of Canoo Inc. and its subsidiaries and are not subject to payment of referral or placement fees if any such candidate is later hired by Canoo unless you have a signed written agreement in place with us which covers the applicable job posting. Canoo cares deeply about the safety of all candidates who may be asked to participate in an in-person interview. While the company remains operational, some of our positions are remote, while others require working on-site. Canoo is following the Covid-19 protocols set forth by local state and federal governance and the CDC guidelines. Candidates who are vaccinated will be asked to provide a copy of proof of vaccination upon arrival for the interview. job_title: Senior Manager, Startups Business Development Operations
job_Description: Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, Economics, Finance, Business or related field.  7+ years of operations/strategic planning/program/product management or business experience.  Job summary Amazon Web Services (AWS), a subsidiary of Amazon.com, is the industry’s leading cloud computing platform. The AWS Startup Specialist team is seeking a talented, experienced, self-directed Worldwide Operations Manager to join an organization that is responsible for accelerating adoption of the AWS platform by startups around the world, and helping entrepreneurs and startups build great companies on top of AWS. AWS is looking for a dynamic and results-driven operations and strategy leader to be responsible for implementing and managing operational processes, projects, and strategy that drive team efficiency & effectiveness. This includes defining reporting, functionality, workflow and operational implementation of various processes to help the team deliver. The successful candidate for this role will be a fast, clear and independent thinker who is naturally curious about how things work, is metrics and number savvy, has an analytical mindset and has demonstrated leadership ability. This person will need an ability to see the big picture/whole system while driving execution on a grass root level to improve the overall success of the organization. You are never satisfied with the status quo, and have the ability to thrive in a fast-paced, customer-centric and ever ambiguous environment. You are passionate about your work, self-motivated, detail oriented and have excellent problem solving abilities. You have superb communication skills, and are able to communicate complex analytical results in a clear and easy to understand way, both written and verbally. Inclusive Team Culture Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have twelve employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust. Work/Life Balance Our team also puts a high value on work-life balance. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here, which is why we aren’t focused on how many hours you spend at work or online. Instead, we’re happy to offer a flexible schedule so you can have a more productive and well-balanced life—both in and outside of work. Mentorship & Career Growth Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. job_title: Sr. Principal Machine Learning Scientist - Telecommute
job_Description: UnitedHealth Group is a company that’s on the rise. We’re expanding in multiple directions, across borders and, most of all, in the way we think. Here, innovation isn’t about another gadget, it’s about transforming the health care industry to improve the lives and health of others. Ready to make a difference? Make yourself at home with us and start doing  your life’s best work  . OptumLabs serves as UnitedHealth Group’s research and development hub. Our vision is to create the most effective, affordable, equitable, and engaging health care solutions that improve patient health outcomes and experience, enhance provider experience, bolster health equity, and make health care more affordable. Our teams leverage big data insights, artificial intelligence, machine learning, and disruptive product development while capitalizing on engineering, clinical, and scientific innovations to build innovative health solutions. Our team, the Machine Learning research team in Optum Labs, is a research team that aspire to develop and apply novel machine learning methodologies that are specifically tailored to healthcare. We aim to develop disruptive technologies that will change healthcare for the better. You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges. Primary Responsibilities: Develop novel machine learning algorithms for prediction of health outcomes and improved care Implement machine learning algorithms from the literature and evaluate their performance Develop machine learning across different data domains (e.g., images, unstructured data, genomics, wearables, and claims), and across different machine learning domains Communicate the performance of the machine learning algorithms across an interdisciplinary team Write both internal and external documentation of the novel algorithms, including publications in machine learning and other scientific conferences and journals Lead, inspire and set the vision for the OptumLabs’ machine learning roadmap You will evaluate and make decisions around the use of new or existing machine learning algorithms and tools, influence other Principals, Directors, and their technical teams to build the right systems and use the right machine learning tools You will present the results of the team’s research in conferences in the field of machine learning in health  You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in. Required Qualifications: PhD in machine learning, computer science, statistics, biomedical informatics, or a related field. 3+ years of experience in machine learning research post-PhD Hands-on experience in implementing and training machine learning algorithms and statistical analysis, including for example non-parametric tests, mixed linear models, modern supervised and unsupervised machine learning algorithms such as SVM, random forest, PCA, t-SNE, clustering, and neural networks Deep understanding of mathematical foundations of machine learning, including statistics, linear algebra, and computer science Programming competence demonstrated in at least one or more of these programming languages: Python, R, Java, C++, Matlab Preferred Qualifications: Knowledge and experience working with health related data, including EMR, medical images, genomics, or claims Software tool development experience: source control (git), packaging, documentation. 5+ years of experience working on hands-on machine learning algorithms Demonstrated ability to work in a team Demonstrated track record of scientific publications in machine learning or a related field Work on health-related fields (e.g., biomedical informatics, bioinformatics, biomathematics) is an advantage Experience working in an interdisciplinary environment Experience with cloud computing Experience communicating with and briefing senior executives Comfortable working in a fast paced, highly collaborative and fluid work environment Demonstrated experience working cross-group with Director and VP-level technical leaders Highly skilled and experienced at creating internal alignment across roles (Engineering, Product, Marketing, Finance, etc.) for strategic projects Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical audiences at the C-level Hands-on software engineering experience Exceptional interpersonal and relationship management skills Strong problem-solving skills: the ability to analyze problems and develop actionable and appropriate tactical plans quickly Strong communication skills, including in an interdisciplinary environment Strong written communication skills of scientific material Excellent problem-solving skills Established publication record Highly organized individual Our Values We Lead with Diversity, Inclusion and Compassion At OptumLabs, we are dedicated to building teams where every individual is recognized for their unique experience and contributions. Our Leadership Principles underscore our commitment to inclusion, encouraging us to “walk in each other’s shoes” and open doors for our peers. UnitedHealth Group supports local, regional, and national organizations that share these values through joint initiatives, event and program participation, volunteerism and giving. Through our Connected Communities, employees can connect with others who have similar – or different – life experiences and backgrounds. These groups are led by peers, supported by Human Capital and championed by leaders. We Invest in Talent. Managers at every level are committed to their roles as talent stewards who help guide and nurture professional development. We want our employees to reach their highest level of potential just as they help us reach ours. Join OptumLabs and you’ll be part of a culture that prizes innovation and works with uncompromising integrity. At OptumLabs, employees are our first customers. That’s why we offer virtual work environments – to provide work/life flexibility via telecommuting. While it can be a struggle to be a telecommuter, it can also provide enormous benefits for your personal and professional life. Sources: https://careers.unitedhealthgroup.com/culture/what-we-offer/ https://careers.unitedhealthgroup.com/culture/life-at-uhg/ https://hub.uhg.com/news/2021-3-10-Introducing-Connected-Communities- 503662/5744  https://careers.unitedhealthgroup.com/culture/inclusion-and-diversity/  To protect the health and safety of our workforce, patients, and communities we serve, UnitedHealth Group and its affiliate companies now require all employees to disclose COVID-19 vaccination status prior to beginning employment. In addition, some roles require full COVID-19 vaccination as an essential job function. UnitedHealth Group adheres to all federal, state, and local COVID-19 vaccination regulations as well as all client COVID-19 vaccination requirements and will obtain the necessary information from candidat es prior to employment to ensure compliance. Candidates must be able to perform all essential job functions with or without reasonable accommodation. Failure to meet the vaccination requirement may result in rescission of an employment offer or termination of employment. Careers at UnitedHealth Group.  We have modest goals: Improve the lives of others. Change the landscape of health care forever. Leave the world a better place than we found it. Such aspirations tend to attract a certain type of person. Crazy talented. Compassionate. Driven. To these select few, we offer the global reach, resources and can-do culture of a Fortune 5 company. We provide an environment where you're empowered to be your best. We encourage you to take risks. And we offer a world of rewards and benefits for performance. We believe the most important is the opportunity to do  your life's best work.(sm) Colorado, Connecticut or Nevada Residents Only:  The salary range for Colorado residents is $134,200 to $257,700. The salary range for Connecticut / Nevada residents is $134,200 to $257,700. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, etc. In addition to your salary, UnitedHealth Group offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). No matter where or when you begin a career with UnitedHealth Group, you’ll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentives. *All Telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy.    Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. job_title: Lead Data Scientist, Product Development, Digital Delivery (ACP)
job_Description: Requisition ID 5510  Country United States of America City Remote About Us Korn Ferry  is a global organizational consulting firm. We help clients synchronize strategy and talent to drive superior performance. We work with organizations to design their structures, roles, and responsibilities. We help them hire the right people to bring their strategy to life. And we advise them on how to reward, develop, and motivate their people. Our 8,600 colleagues serve clients in more than  50 countries . We offer five core solutions: Organizational Strategy Assessment and Succession Talent Acquisition Leadership Development Rewards and Benefits  Job description Senior Data Scientist ROLE SUMMARY Lead data science projects focused on developing machine learning production models that will help Korn Ferry Digital platform innovate new services or user experiences. With a background in data science (adept at handling large, complex datasets, applying analytical and statistical processes and techniques) must be able to shape the direction of the team and coordinate work streams to deliver the most impactful machine learning products. RESPONSIBILITIES Machine Learning Algorithm Design and Research Take responsibility for developing and delivering a major part of the organization's machine learning research and development projects. Algorithm Impact Assessment Define appropriate metrics, assess activities, and recommend improvements based on metrics and analyses. Advanced and Predictive Analytics Create well-defined road maps that align predictive analytics projects with business needs, leading cross-functional teams in the implementation and ongoing use of advanced predictive analytics' technique and functionalities. Information and Business Advice Provide specialist advice to the collaboration teams to build measurement and metrics, and the design and implementation of Machine Learning products and initiatives. Insights and Reporting Set and lead execution of the data and analytics roadmap, creating strategies and solutions to yield business outcome. Create, present, and communicate high-impact data and analytics insights and recommendations to critical internal and external stakeholders. Technical Competency Deep research experience in data science domain especially around statistical learning, NLP and Deeplearning models. Understand ML development cycles and ML CICD operations. Proficient in Python, Spark, TensorFlow, SKlearn and related tools, proven record delivering different types of models in production environment, minimum 10-15 years industry experience. Management experience is preferred.  Background Post graduate degrees in Computer Science or equivalent fields. Ph. D. in computer science preferred.   Korn Ferry is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer - Minority/Female/Disability/ Veteran. Remote position that can be located in the US or Canada E INC is the parent company of EBlock and EDealer, unifying our approach to products, services, and strategies under one Vision and one Mission: to create the best digital auction and retailing platform in the world by connecting the automotive wholesale and retail experiences. Our brands and their technologies make it easy for a vehicle to move between buyers and sellers throughout its entire ownership lifecycle. Learn more at https://e.inc/ E INC is on a growth trajectory in the automotive B2B space creating Data hungry groups within the company and need for data analytics as each day goes by. The Data Analytics team is relatively small team but full of growth opportunity for a candidate to evolve in the field of Business Intelligence, Data Engineering and Data Science. The Data Analytics team is seeking a Sr. Data Analyst to help drive Digital/ Web Analytics.  The role with work with stakeholders from  Marketing as well as Retail business group to  pull data and perform analyses to drive business decision making. Analyze data to identify trends, patterns, anomalies, and other helpful information and at times, be prepared to present findings and discuss trends and insights. Review and improve data and analytics processes, methods, and tools to increase efficiency and accuracy. What You Will Do   The role will focus on data, analysis, metrics development, experimentation (A/B Testing) and its application to Digital business strategies that includes web product and marketing  Develop, model and apply analytical best practices delivering insights, storytelling and elevate data analyst organization  Be expert in Data function and integrate with business to deliver and influence stakeholders with impactful communication and actionable insights  Drive development of problem statement, approach, and the metrics and measurement strategy, including success criteria, to determine and improve the value of your work through a deep understanding of the business, business process, data ecosystem and rapid data mining  Analyze campaign data through extensive data digging and develop specific recommendations to improve performance and identify new opportunities  Be self-directed and drive execution towards outcomes, understand business interdependencies, conduct detailed problem solving, use independent judgement and decision making to deliver as per product scope, provide inputs to establish product/ project timelines  Define and measure success rate of how dashboard/analysis/insights are adapted into decision making, create feedback loops to enhance analysis  Champion learning forums, or be a mentor to help increase awareness and adoption of current technical topics relevant for Data Analyst competency e.g. BI tools and technologies; Descriptive & Inferential analytics  Job duties may change at any time due to business needs.   What You Will Need   Bachelor’s degree in Science, Business, Marketing  Degree in technical/analytics field preferred  At least 5 years of experience in digital marketing web analytics  Proficiency with web analytics fundamentals (Google Analytics/ Adobe Analytics) and solid understanding of tag management implementation and A/B testing  Experience with analyzing marketing campaign data and collaborating with digital marketing channels (Paid, SEO, CRO)  Experience in analytics tools such as: SQL, Excel, Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Python, R, Domo and/or equivalent technologies  BI Tool experience: Tableau or PowerBI  Able to support conclusions with analytical evidence using descriptive stats, inferential stats and data visualizations  Excellent communication skills with the ability to speak to both business and technical teams, and translate ideas between them  Comfort with ambiguity and open-ended problems in support of digital business and operations   E INC is a growing company that is continuing to evaluate our ongoing commitment and investment in our team members with:   Competitive pay  Sales Incentive Bonus  Medical, Dental & Vision  401k/RSP with Match   Paid time off (Vacation, Personal, Volunteer)  Flexible working environment  Continuous Learning  And an amazing culture to top it all off! The Senior People Analytics Data Analyst is data analyst as well as a part time consultant and storyteller. This role is a good fit for critical thinkers who see connections where others may not, ask the right questions and create the data story that sits buried in our people data. They work within the context of the big picture and see how the right questions and assumptions can drive the path of the analysis. The Senior People Analytics Data Analyst must be highly skilled in understanding a problem within its context, developing and/or deploying appropriate analytical tools, and presenting findings in a clear and actionable manner to tell a story about our talent. Responsibilities  Provide analytical support for multiple global initiatives, projects, and programs  Engage as an analytics consultant to HR and business leadership  Design appropriate analytical approaches to projects based on resources and priority  Perform data analyses using appropriate methods and tools  Retrieve and analyze data and present results of analysis to leadership for use in supporting operations and realizing business objectives  Weave these findings into compelling stories that help leaders understand their talent in deeper ways  Work with data source systems and target systems to identify data issues and data gaps  The Senior People Analytics Consultant will also be responsible for one or more of the following:  Statistical analyses  Data engineering and pipelining  Machine Learning/AI  Predictive Analytics   Expertise:   Bachelors degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Business Administration, Science or equivalent  3+ years experience in data analytics  Expertise in programming languages such as SQL, Python, SAS, R  Experience working with data warehouses and cloud storage (Snowflake, Azure, Amazon S3, etc)  Experience with statistical methods used for data analysis (ANOVA, Rare Event testing, Confidence Intervals, etc.)  Expertise with both supervised and unsupervised Machine Learning models and other AI projects  Hands-on experience working with Tableau, Power BI, Looker or similar BI tools  Passion for using data to uncover insights and drive business performance  Strong verbal and written communication skills to support data storytelling  Creative problem-solving ability, working in ambiguous situations  Ability to prioritize and multi-task effectively in a fast-paced environment  Why IDEXX We’re proud of the work we do, because our work matters. An innovation leader in every industry we serve, we follow our Purpose and Guiding Principles to help pet owners worldwide keep their companion animals healthy and happy, to ensure safe drinking water for billions, and to help farmers protect livestock and poultry from disease. We have customers in over 175 countries and a global workforce of over 9,000 talented people. So, what does that mean for you? We enrich the livelihoods of our employees with a positive and respectful work culture that embraces challenges and encourages learning and discovery. At IDEXX, you will be supported by competitive compensation, incentives, and benefits while enjoying purposeful work that drives improvement. Let’s pursue what matters together. job_title: Postdoctoral Researcher, Computational Social Science (Core Data Science)
job_Description: Meta is looking for a Postdoctoral Researcher to join the Computational Social Science group within the Core Data Science team. Computational Social Science is an interdisciplinary team of quantitative scientists that aims to deliver research and innovation to improve existing products and inform and enable the development of new ones. The team works closely with various product groups throughout Meta, bringing expertise in algorithms, modeling, machine learning, exploratory data analysis, and social network analysis. We help these teams better understand how people use their products, and we solve hard problems that will enable these products to better serve their users.    Work with large amounts of data in service of concrete conclusions and actionable insights Communicate complicated technical topics and nuanced insights to diverse audiences Learn new tools and languages quickly as required by the particular project you are working on, with tasks ranging from data processing to production engineering to modeling and machine learning Work both independently and collaboratively with other scientists, engineers, designers, UX researchers, and product managers to accomplish complex tasks that deliver demonstrable value to Meta's community of billions of users Think creatively, proactively, and futuristically to identify new opportunities within Meta's long-term roadmap for data-scientific contributions    Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining a PhD, in computer science, statistics, economics, sociology or related field Experience in machine learning, deep learning, statistical analysis, or social network analysis Experience in analysis and visualization using off-the-shelf statistical computing software such as R, Python or Julia Experience manipulating and analyzing data from various sources, including with distributed computing tools like Hive and Presto Must obtain work authorization in country of employment at the time of hire, and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment Experience in writing production code in PHP, Python, C++, or Java     Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.  Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. At Standard Cognition, we’re revolutionizing the way the world shops. By replacing cash registers with computer vision-powered checkout, we’re creating a frictionless experience for shoppers. Since launching in 2017, Standard has contracts with multiple global retailers and is in the process of deploying our Standard Checkout solution across thousands of stores globally. We’re backed by some of Silicon Valley’s leading investors including Softbank, CRV, Initialized, EQT, Draper Associates and YCombinator. We just announced our Series C in February 2021!  We're building a soft real-time machine learning system that provides shoppers with a seamless checkout experience. Our system is vision only, and every store must stream process terabytes of video per day from hundreds of cameras, touching on a multitude of interconnected models. We're pushing the limits of what video comprehension can achieve, and we're expanding to do it at scale. You'll be helping us solve problems that few teams have ever tackled.  We use techniques from both ML and Deep Learning, and merge them with powerful approaches from applied graph theory, combinatorics, and optimization theory. Collectively, we create state of the art systems that can visually track visitors and their actions across the most challenging real world multi-camera environments, without ever relying on facial recognition.  As a successful Machine Learning Engineer (MLE) at Standard, you will design and build high-quality production inference systems that drive key impacts to our core business. All our ML Engineers contribute to the full life cycle of model development, from cross-functional data set acquisition, to training pipelines, to model design, to scaling out model serving and monitoring. If this sounds like fun, we'd love to hear from you!  This is a  FULL TIME remote  role located anywhere in the  United States or the European Union.   What you'll do here: Contribute to the end to end development of state of the art machine learning systems, from metric definition and data set creation to model deployment and monitoring Solve modeling problems at the cutting edge of production machine learning Work cross-functionally with operation teams in data creation and labeling to help design our massive data sets Contribute to solving our complex discrete optimization challenges, from multi-view tracking to optimal assignment problems Your skillset: Experience building production ML or CV systems Proficient in Python Proficient in at least one systems language such as Rust, C++, or Java (we use Rust!) Experience with solving software problems using applied graph theory, combinatorics, or discrete optimization techniques Experience with Kalman filters, particle filters, and data association techniques, or experience with graph traversal techniques such as beam search Comfortable taking traditional filtering or search techniques and marrying them with modern ML techniques You communicate clearly and possess the ability to work cross-functionally across team boundaries You are able to problem solve in a flexible manner You are passionate about the entire ML lifecycle Only meet some of these skills? We'd still love to hear from you! Why you might want to work with us: We take care of you and your family with health, vision, and dental insurance. You will have the option to contribute to a 401k. You're excited to work on a product that will impact almost any consumer, almost anywhere. Standard is a remote first company. We trust you to get your job done in the location that works best for you. We dress casually. Some of us wear slippers in the office. In current work from home standings, we’re super comfy. We believe in a culture of learning, and want to keep building our skills, experiences, and capabilities. We offer flexible work schedules. We trust our team to know how they will do their best work. We're family friendly. We want our teammates to focus on what they need to when they need to. We offer very competitive compensation, including equity in Standard, to each one of our employees. Standard provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetics, sexual orientation, gender identity, or gender expression. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce and welcome people from all backgrounds, experiences, perspectives, and abilities.  Not quite ready to apply? Send us an email at jobs@standard.ai. Someone from the team will follow up to answer your questions.
